div.head: The WIDOW's MITE, Humbly osser'd, not impos'd; shewing by Scripture, why the seventh Day of the Lord's Rest is to be kept in Christ, under the Name Christian and Gospel Dispensation, and that Christ, which is Spirit, was one with the Father in creating, when God said, Come let us make Man, Gen. 1.26. and their Sabbath of Rest, after six Days of their creating, ch. 2.2, 3. and Exodus 16.23. and ch. 20.10. and many more Scriptures; the seventh Day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God, not Jewish seventh Day, and was before Jew or Gentile by Name was upon the Earth, or Sin entered the World; and the Day of their Rest hath never been abolished, and the Commandments stand good, and are teached to this Day, as Exodus 20. sheweth.
div.p: MANY hath been the Disputes, and still is, concerning the Lord's holy Rest, which Holy Rest is written with the Finger of God, and is a Weekly Sabbath, the seventh Day in the Commandments; and no Sabbath written with the Finger of God but the Lord's holy Rest in the Commandments, and is a Christian Sabbath under the Gospel, as under the Law, as joyning to the Lord in Worship, according to the Lord's Example, Gen. 2.2. and Exod. 16. and 20. the Commandments delivered to Moses, and the Lord hath sent his Son to bless his People, with the Incomes of his Spiritual Presence, but not to disannul the Ten Commandments and the Sound of the Angels; with the Angel of the Lord is Peace on Earth, Good-will towards Men, Luke 2.14.

The other Sabbaths given the Jews under the Law, were given for several Services, to be kept in Holiness, and Moses delivered the Appointment of them Sabbaths, as he received the Words from God, to deliver to the People, and to be observed in their several Months, and Weeks, and Monthly Sabbaths, of the New Moon and Yearly Feasts, but not Weekly any Sabbath to be kept in the Name of the Lord's holy Rest and Sabbath; but the Lord's holy Rest, which is every seventh Day, and the Lord hath commanded it to be kept holy, and calls for a remembrance upon it, not a seventh Day, but the seventh Day after six of Labour; and under the Gospel, the Resurrection of Jesus, which the Power of God did so gloriously appear, and maintained the Word of the Kingdom, in raising the Body the third Day, is worthy of remembrance; and to keep two Days in seven in Holiness, (each particular may hope to prosper the better in the other five Days) and to wait for the Resurrection of that Seed which gives Life and Resurrection to the waiting Soul, and so to receive the Word of the Kingdom in Spirit, and the baptizing Power of the Holy Ghost, which is the remembrancer, and gives fore-sight of every good Work; and so to wait, that that Power which raised Jesus from the Dead, may arise in each particular, and that all may so wait to know a Resurrection from the Death of Sin, and live to God in the Spirit which gives Life, and a glorious Resurrection when the Body dies; for it is the Body of Flesh which is prepared to die, the Spirit never dies, but goes to God which gave it Man to live by, of his own Substance Spiritual, and the Spirit descending in a universal manner at the Birth of Jesus, to visit them that waited for the Consolation of Israel, Luke 2.25. and is worthy of remembrance; and to bow before the Power of God, which sent the Prophet to bless and inspire the People with the Word of God, which he received from God the anointing Power in him; and in that Word and Spirit he baptized the People with the Holy Ghost when he came in to his Ministry; and the Father and Son, which is the Holy
Ghost, spake in him and baptized the People, to follow the holy Example of Jesus, and after the Resurrection, that power in Jesus breathed on the Disciples, and said, receive ye the Holy Ghost; but did not call the first Day the seventh Day, nor a Sabbath Day, nor the Sabbath Day, for the Sabbath is the Day before the Resurrection on the first Day of the Week, as the Body was crucified the Day before the Sabbath, Mark 15.42. and the holy Women returned, and prepared Spices and Ointments, and rested the Sabbath Day, according to the Commandment; and Matthew gives the Account, from the sixth Hour there was Darkness until the ninth Hour, ch. 27. v. 45. and 57. when the Even was come, Joseph of Arimathea, he went to Pilate and begged the Body of Jesus, and Pilate commanded the Body to be delivered; and Mark gives the account, it was the third Hour, and they crucified him, ch. 15. v. 25. and 33. when the sixth Hour was come, there was a Darkness over the whole Land until the ninth Hour; so the third Hour and sixth Hour till the ninth Hour must be in the Morning, because they wondered at the Darkness, which if it had been Night, the Darkness was in its place. And when Even was come, because it was the Preparation, that is the Day before the Sabbath, Joseph of Arimathea, an honourable Councellor, which also waited for the Kingdom of God, craved the Body of Jesus, Mark 15.42. and Luke gives the account, it was about the sixth Hour, and there was a Darkness over all the Earth, and the Sun (ch. 23. v. 44.) was darkned: So this Darkness over all the Earth and Sun must be in the Morning, at the sixth and ninth Hour: and John gives the account, it was the Preparation, that the Bodies should not remain on the Cross on the Sabbath Day, ch. 19. v. 31. and all agree it was the ninth Hour that Jesus gave up the Ghost, and at the sixth Hour that Darkness was till the ninth Hour; and they all agree, that Jesus was crucified the Day before the Sabbath, and they all call the Day of the Resurrection of the Body the first Day of the Week, the Day after the Sabbath, and after the Crucifixion of the Bodily Presence. On the Sabbath Day the Chief Priests and Pharisees came together to Pilate, that he might command the Sepulchre to be made sure until the third Day, and their coming together was on the Sabbath, which they did not hold lawful to do any outward Business, according to the Commandments, but this being an extraordinary Thing, and the Judgment upon them great for what they had blindfoldly done, not discerning the Power which work'd within the Veil, but could not rest from one another, discoursing the Matter, and seeking to secure the Sepulchre, and all Things was so suffered, that the Power of God might be made manifest in raising the Dead; but when the Angel descended, and roul'd away the Stone, the Power of God brought their Works to nothing. Men in every Generation have been disobedient, and made Trespasses in doing what they ought not, to their own Condemnation; but this does not make it lawful to break the Sabbath, the seventh Day of the Lord's rest; and as the Lord hath called the Days, I think it my Duty to call the Day, and I can't have a better Guide than to begin and end the Day as the Lord hath created it, and it appears to us in this lower Region, and as it stands recorded, and the Record hath been kept to by the Churches when they read the Law every Sabbath Day, and the Commandments written with the Finger of God, and his Power hath preserved a Record to his People to this Day, according to the Scripture Testimony and Signs of Heaven; and what one Word in the Ten Commandments is contrary to the Gospel, or the Spiritual Worship? And Men have seen the Work of God through his Angels and ministring Spirits, sent forth to them which shall be Heirs of Salvation, and he hath sent his Servants the Prophets to declare his Word, and to shew his Mind and Will, calling to Holiness, and Men have seen the Evening of the Law, and the Morning of the Gospel, which will both spring into a glorious Day, when the Love, Peace and Charity which is fixed in the Commandments takes place; which Peace points to the Gospel, which is for love to Neighbours, Unity and Peace, and to pray for Enemies; and the Lord's Words and Commands carry a Power with them, and hath ever made the Earth to tremble, and bow before him, and David and the Prophets were Witnesses of this great Word sent to both Princes
and People; and it is the Spirit and Word from God, from his Mouth immediately given, which will unite both Jew and Gentile, to be one in the Work and Worship of God, and to see his Power over all his Works, and him to be the Creator, Redeemer and Sanctifier and Saviour of his People, through every Ministring Angel and Seer, through both the Law and Gospel to this Day; it is the Spirit of the Father which is in Christ his Son, which is all-saving, the Spirit of Grace, the Spirit of Truth, the Angel of his Presence, the Power of an endless Life, King of Righteousness, King of Peace, the Spirit sent of the Father through the Son in Spirit, to work the Work of Reconciliation between God and Man, that Man might be redeemed from the Fall, to serve God in Spirit out of Sin, and follow the holy Pattern sent in the Flesh to be an Example, who delivered the Words of God, and spake as the Spirit gave him utterance, as the Disciples after did, as the Holy Ghost filled them with the Spirit and Words of Wisdom, to minister to the People; and they which are most in earnest with their own Soul please God best, and it is most for their peace, notwithstanding a Scholar may out-talk by Art an innocent Man, but the Secrets of God are with them that fear him, and he may out-word him one Time, yet keeping to the Grace, the Lord by his Word will help him to conquer another time, in the Faith and Patience, keeping to Truth the Spiritual Rock, and them which are teached in Christ's School, will prove the best Learning in the end, and he is the best Teacher which knows the Heart and the Infirmities of the Mind, and is a present help in the needful Time of Trouble, and when the Enemy comes in as a Flood, the Spirit of God will lift up a Standard against him, and cast him out with his rebellious Works; and as all joyn with the Spirit of the Lord, he will give them a Mind both to will and to do, and teach Man by his Spirit in the inward Man, which is Christ's School, which Power will finish the Work as Man obeys the Power; and God is the same for ever, and the Day of his Rest the same, and never changed, and the Commandments bear their Authority, being written with the Finger of God, and that part of the Law which consists in Ordinances, and of Sacrifices and Offerings is one thing, and the Ten Commandments is ever distinguished to be another; as the Law given to Moses very often does distinguish from Sacrifices which are Carnal, which were a Figure for the time present, in which were offered both Gifts and Sacrifices, which could not make him that did the Service perfect, as pertaining to the Conscience, which stood only in Meats and Drinks, and divers Washings, and Carnal Ordinances, till the time of Reformation, Hebrews 9.9, 10. and if the Priest that did the Service was not perfected thereby, which was a Covenant-Offering to be accepted as Sin is forsaken, no more could the People without a perfect Heart be joyn'd to the Lord in Holiness and good Works, and as Light and Perfection was written upon Aaron's Breast-plate, the Ʋrim and the Thummim, which Ʋrim and Thummim signifie Light and Perfection, pointing to the Kingdom of Christ, the Spirit of the Father, uniting in Spirit, through the Son, and shewing what it is makes perfect, and that it is Light and Perfection written in the Heart, and Christ one in Spirit with the Father, is come the Spirit of Truth, and Light and Perfection is in him, which speaks to the Heart, he is the everlasting High-Priest, after the Order of Melchisedeck, and is in the power of an endless Life, and not after the Order of Aaron, but is the faithful and true Witness, giving account of Man's Deeds, and is a Witness in Man's Conscience on Earth, and he is a second Witness, the Book of Life, either to justifie the Good, or condemn the Evil, the Spirit of Truth is the Judge of both quick and dead, and the Holy One hath set an Example in Worship, speaking in Spirit, through the Veil, Man's Flesh out of Carnal Ordinances, as the other Covenants was; and Christ in the Father, being Spirit as the Father is Spirit, they kept the Day of their Rest in Spirit, before Sin entered the World, as farther is mentioned; and after the Offerings of the Law, the Gospel is preached, and Christ the everlasting High-Priest is come, and the Works of the Spirit is preach'd, and the Worship is still in the Spirit, and the same God that is the Alpha will be the Omega, and Christ
is a Spirit and not Carnal, as the Offerings for Sin then were; and in its time the Lord did accept as Atonements for Carnal Sins, but under the Gospel, the Ministration in Spirit is sent in a universal manner to them that wait for that holy Power, the pure anointing Grace, and that which finds acceptance with the Father and Son, is a broken Heart and contrite Spirit, and to tremble at his Word; and in the room of such Offerings for Peace and Sacrifices for Sin, the Light of Christ is a Lamp in his People, and the Fiery Baptism of the Holy Ghost, purges out Sin in all that wait for it, that they may appear before the Throne of Grace in Peace, in the one Offering and Mediator. And when the Lord rested the seventh Day, the World was but seven Days old, and as afore-written Sin had not entered the World, and therefore no need of a Carnal Offering, as was after given the Jews, Sheep, and Oxen, and Kids of the Goats, Lambs and Rams, and Doves and Pidgeons, Offerings for Sin, and be Holy, for without Holiness no Man can see the Lord, and Christ the Holy One is come, the better Offering, and above all Carnal Offerings; and as God is not changed, so the Day of his Rest is not changed; and Christ the Spirit of Truth is High-Priest for ever after the Order of Melchisedeck, without Father, without Mother, without Descent, having neither beginning of Days nor end of Life, a High-Priest continually, Hebrews 7.2, 3. but the Veil to the Power and Spirit, had an espoused Father Joseph, and a fleshly Mother Mary, and had a Descent from the Loyns of Abraham and David, and down to Adam, and is recorded the Son of Adam as having a Body of Flesh, Matthew 1.19, 20. and after the Son of God, as he did the Works of God, and tasted Death upon the Cross, and to give place to the great Creator, the Power that worketh all things both in Heaven and Earth, is to keep the seventh Day of his Rest holy, and he put the Day of his Rest into a Command, and it was the first Day instituted for Divine Worship; and if it were but to remember the great Works of Creation, the seventh Day ought to be kept, and to remember the Sign given, that it is the same God which sanctifies the People, both Saints and Prophets, and by his Light preserves his Angels from Darkness, and hath given every Scripture from Genesis to the Revelations, the Author of every Mercy, through every Instrument sent, all is received from his Almighty Power, which sends both Men and Angels to bless the People, the Work of his Creation, and to give Glory to the Power, may be a means to bring the whole Vineyard of the Earth to grow, and to be of one Mind, in him that is true, and hath set an Example of keeping their Rest, and to see God in all his Attributes, as Almighty Lord God, and Creator, Redeemer and Saviour, Israel's King; and to see the Power of God, in the Angel of his Presence, and the Word of God in every ministring Angel and ministring Spirit, Seer, or Man of God, or Prophet, sent, not to be another God, but to do the Will of God; and when the Lord, Creator, Redeemer and Saviour, his Mercy is seen in every Messenger sent, it will be a great means to set a stop to so many Divisions and Forms of Worship, and to see the end and sign of every Covenant, and to see what Covenants stand, and what Covenants appertaining to the Law is taken away; before there was any Law, the first Covenant is with Day and Night, and after the Bow in the Clouds, which remains a Sign that God will never totally drown the World, a wonderful Sign of his Power, and is ministred to the World as he pleaseth, and God renewed his Covenant to Abraham, and said, I am Almighty God, walk before me and be thou perfect, Gen. 17.1. as for me, my Covenant is with thee, and thou shalt be a Father of many Nations; I will make thee exeeeding fruitful; I will make Nations of thee, and Kings shall come out of thee, v. 7. I will establish my Covenant between me and thee, and thy Seed after thee in their Generation, for an everlasting Covenant, to be a God to thee and thy Seed after thee; and this Covenant stands, for Jesus was of the Seed of Abraham and David, according to the Flesh, and the Increase will be great, and God is now the sanctifier of his People which are faithful to him, as Abraham was; but Circumcision in the Gospel of Peace is taken off in the Flesh, Romans 4.11. notwithstanding, Jesus being of the Seed of Abraham, received the Token of the Covenant,
that God would be a God to Abraham's Seed; and Jesus was circumcised the eighth Day, and when grown up to be a Man, received John's Baptism of Water also, Matt. 3.14. and after he received the Water-Baptism, which he bid John suffer it to be so now, and after the Holy Ghost descended upon him, the Power in him baptized with the Holy Ghost and as John's Baptism was in the room of Circumcision, so the Baptism of the Holy Ghost is prefer'd before John's Water Baptism; and the Lord's Covenant to be a God to Abraham and his Seed stands fast in Exod. 20.2, 3. thou shalt have no other Gods before me, and the Covenant and Sign stands good, that it is God which sanctifieth his People, ch. 31.16, 17, 18. and ch. 34.28. and Moses was with the Lord forty Days and forty Nights, he neither eat Bread, nor drank Water, and he wrote upon the Tables the Words of the Covenant the Ten Commandments, Deut. 9.9. and the Lord renewed his Covenant made to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, to give them the Land, and the Lord appeared unto Moses by his Name Jehovah, Exod. 6.2, 3. and God spake to Moses, and said, I am the Lord, and I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, by the Name of God Almighty, but by my Name Jehovah was I not known to them: And God was pleased to make another Covenant with the House of Israel, which the Christians under the Gospel have a promise to share in, Joel 2.28. the Spirit to be poured forth upon all Flesh; and the Lord hath made many Covenants with his People under several Attributes, his powerful Names, and as the Blood of Bulls, and Goats, and the Ashes of an Heifer is rejected, so the one Offering in Spirit is established, and the Spirit descends and ascends, and the Lord accepts of what he gives, and this is the new Covenant, the Law written in the Heart and put in the Mind, and the obedient ones they do the Will of God; but the Lord God and Creator, and the Day of his Rest, and the Ten Commandments are the same, notwithstanding the Day of their Rest are not kept by Nations, only a few bear Witness in keeping the seventh Day of his Rest after his great and mighty Works in creating, and instituted a Day of Worship for Man to obey, before the Man of the Dust of the Ground was formed; and as to Offerings, the Apostle giving an Account of the Work wrought by the power of God in Jesus, or the Office of Christ, the ministration of the Spirit in him, wherefore when he cometh into the World, he saith, Sacrifice and Offerings thou wouldst not, but a Body hast thou prepared me; in Burnt-Offerings and Sacrifices for Sin thou hast had no pleasure: then said I, Lo I come, in the volume of the Book it is written of me, to do thy Will, O God; above, when he said, Sacrifice and Offerings, and Burnt-Offerings for Sin thou wouldst not, neither had pleasure therein; then said he, Lo I come to do thy Will, O God, he taketh away the first that he may establish the second, (and by doing the Will of God is the sanctification) by which Will we are sanctified (as saith the Apostle) they which are Spiritual are sanctified, through the Offering of the Body (Christ in Jesus) once for all, Hebrews 10.5. to 15. for by one Offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified, (that is, as each particular that does the Will of God as he did, they are perfected by that Example, and sanctified in doing the Will of God according to that Example) whereof, saith the Apostle, the Holy Ghost is Witness; and saith the Apostle, ye have need of Patience, that after ye have done the Will of God ye might receive the Promise, ver. 36. so the offering the Body once for all is, that Man should be sanctified in Body, Soul and Spirit, to follow the holy Obedience of Jesus, or they have no part in his Sufferings; and the Offering in Spirit is established by the Office of Christ, the Power of God, the power of an endless Life, a spiritual Ministration in his waiting ones, the Law written in the Heart, and put in the Mind, and this Covenant and Offering salted with the seasoning Grace, the Fiery Baptism of the Holy Ghost, which cannot lose its savour; for every one shall be salted with Fire, and every Sacrifice shall be salted with Salt; Salt is good▪ but if the Salt have lost its saltness, wherewith will you season it, have Salt in your selves, and have Peace one with another, Mark 9.49, 50. Matt. 5.13. Levit. 2.13. neither shalt thou suffer the Salt of the Covenant of thy God to be lacking, with all thy Meat Offerings thou shalt offer Salt, and without the Covenant of Salt to every Meat Offering, it was not to be accepted;
and when the Offerings were accepted of the Lord, there came Fire from before the Lord as a sign of Acceptance, and it humbled the People, 1 Kings 18.38. 2 Chron. 7.1. Levit. 9.24. and gave them Faith to believe, as Faith is the Gift of God, and they saw the Works of the true God, and by Faith Abel offered unto God a more excellent Sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained Witness that he is righteous, God testifying of his Gifts, and by it he being dead, yet speaketh, Heb 11.4. Gen. 4.4. and under the Gospel Law, the seasoning Grace of Faith is both Salt and Fire, purifying both Heart and Mind to see that Life and Light which is everlasting; for in the Holy One's Seed there is no Corruption; and the Apostle speaking of the Offering the Body prepared to do the Will of God, (in the Works of the Spirit which works and purges out Sin, as all are obedient to the Works of the Spirit) he makes the first Offering for Sin, the old Covenant, such as Blood of Bulls, Lambs, Sheep and Goats, and Rams, and Pidgeons, and the Ashes of an Heifer; for the Law having a Shadow of the good Things to come, and not the very Image of the things, can never with these Sacrifices which they offer Year by Year continually, make the comers thereunto perfect, for then would they not have ceased, Heb. 10.1, 4. so that the Apostle treating of the first Covenant of Sacrifices and Offerings, (which if the Heart and Ear were circumcised) such found Acceptance in their Obedience, and then Offerings ceased. The Apostle did not here treat upon the Ten Commandments, which remains, and the Sabbath a Sign, that God is the God which doth sanctifie his People, as afore-written; and the Day of his Rest a Sabbath, in remembrance of the six Days of his Creation, in honour due to his great creating Name; as the great Creator of Heaven and Earth, the Seas and the Fountains of Water, the Almighty God, the Lord of Heaven and Earth, the I am, and the Jehovah, he hath commanded the Day of his glorious Rest to be kept; look into it, see the Disobedience the World lieth in, and till Nations are seen in the universal Love and come to keep the Commandments, the Holy Rest in Holiness, Wars will never cease; and saith the Apostle, as speaking of the Power descending when he cometh into the World, he saith, A Body hast thou prepared me to do thy Will, O God; and Jesus was that Body prepared for the Spirit to work in; and in this Body prepared the Word of God appeared, to inspire them which received it, and they became Witnesses in the Spirit, of the Works of the Spirit and Power of God, the new Covenant working in Man, in the universal Love and Light, not only to Witnesses and Prophets, which were Witnesses of the Power of God, and so Christ's Day; but to all which receive the Word, and wait for it, they are inspired by it; Christ is the Spirit of God in Man, the Immanuel God with us, and God with us is the Spirit of Truth; and Jesus foretold his Disciples, he that dwelleth with you shall be in you, John 14.16, 17. and they were after filled with the Holy Ghost, and spake as the Spirit gave them utterance • as Christ was in Jesus, the great Prophet, the Spirit of Truth, so Christ the Lord was in all the Prophets, and the People were to be begotten into the Word and universal Spirit in the inward Man, the Dispensation of the Father through the Son, which Son is Spirit and not Flesh, but is the Spirit which quickens and speaks now in Man, the Words of Spirit and Life, and this Word is Spirit and Life in every Work of God; and notwithstanding the Church under the Gospel, as Saints and Prophets is come, and many coming to Mount Zion to which the Apostle gives witness of, yet they went through many Steps in Grace before they knew a coming to the general Assembly and Church of the First-born, which are written in Heaven, and to God the Judge of all, and to the Spirits of just Men made perfect; and to Jesus Christ the Mediator of the new Covenant, and to the Blood of Sprinkling, that speaketh better things than that of Abel, Heb. 12.22, 23, 24. and saith the Apostle, ye are come unto Mount Zion, and to the City of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to an innumerable Company of Angels, to the general Assembly and Church of the First-born, which are written in Heaven; and the City belonging to this Church is the heavenly Jerusalem, and the Assembly before the Judge of all, is an innumerable Company of Angels, which is the Spirits of just Men made perfect,
which is a gradual Work; but to miss the First Day, instituted for divine and spiritual Worship, when God rested in himself and all his Works which he had made, and behold they were very good, and to miss the first Step, as afore-written, is not to get the higher degree of Grace and Peace in the Holy Ghost, which gives Admittance through the Names of Jesus Christ into the Gospel; and them which were of the Twelve Tribes, a certain Number of every Tribe sealed the Father gave the Son; and John saw upon Mount Zion, the Lamb stood with them, which had his Father's Name written in their F • reheads, Rev. 14.1. Yet notwithstanding the Father is pleased to give them which were his, both the Tribes, and Saints, and Prophets under the Law, to the Son and Word, to unite in the spiritual Building, the heavenly Jerusalem, and when the Sin is subdued, and all brought into the Spirit of the Son to obey the Words of God, the Son is then to deliver up the Kingdom to the Father, which gave him Power to gather into the Kingdom of God, to the Lord of Hosts, the God of both Angels and Men, the eternal and everlasting Being of Beings, the one God which is Almighty, and the Day of his Rest to be held in everlasting Remembrance of his great Works of Creation, and he is also the Redeemer of his People from Generation to Generation, it is his Mercy through every Instrument sent in his Power to save the People in every Age.

The Lord being pleased of his wonderful Goodness to call me to keep the Seventh Day of his Rest a Holy Sabbath to the Lord, out of Labour, according as the Commandment stands good; and I pondered the Weight of the Matter in my Mind, and could not go on in outward Business on that Day; and as I pondered the Weight of the Matter in my Mind, it opened more and more, and Scriptures were opened in my View, and I was more and more enlightened, in the Light which the Scriptures gives both in the Old Testament and the New; and it was given me to distinguish between the Lord's holy Rest and the Jews Sabbaths, given them to afflict for Sin, and them Sabbaths abolished in the one Offering to them which believe in the Gospel Dispensation, following the holy Example of Jesus, (and Sin is also to be abolished in the Mind); but the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest before Sin was, is not abolished, for the holy Rest is in Christ the Spirit of Truth, which rested in the Father, the Seventh Day, after Six Days of their Creation; and the Lord was pleased to open my Understanding to see the true Record of the right Seventh Day were preserved, and the Account given by himself, and written with the Finger of God, and that the Commandments are teached and preached and not kept; all which I laid up in my Heart, and kept the Seventh Day, and did not let any know for a considerable Time that I did keep it, and I thought to keep a Day to the Lord, according to the Commandments, was no hurt to any, but I found it did quiet my Mind to obey the Call; but when Work was to be done on that Day, I was then made to own the keeping the Seventh Day, by refusing to do any outward Business upon the Seventh and First Day of the Week; the First Day (known by the Name of Sunday) I had always observed, and grew strongly convinced in the keeping of both, and I obeyed the Voice and searched the Scriptures, and dare not hide the keeping of either; and when it was known, many argued with me against keeping the Seventh Day, calling it Jewish Seventh Day; but when I asked them if it was called the Jewish Seventh Day in the Ten Commandments? they answered No; then I had reason enough to ask them, Why they called the Lord's Rest Jewish? And some would ask if there were more Sabbaths? I then answered Yes, many Sabbaths given the Jews to afflict for Sin, and called their Sabbaths, and Sabbaths to rejoice in at the ingathering of the Corn and Fruits of the Earth; they held Sabbaths which were given them to rejoice in, at which they had set Feasts of Charitable Acts, and the Widow and Fatherless, and Stranger were to partake with them of the Blessings and the Increase, after the Priest had waved a Sheaf before the the Lord, on the Morrow after the Sabbath, which Morrow after the Sabbath was the First Day, and may tipify then another Sabbath for Acts of Charity and Mercy, to be heal'd
in the Christian Faith, under the Gospel of Peace; and the Apostles appointed holy Men to take Care of the Widows, Acts 6.1, 2. And the Lord had a People in Christ under the Law, as also under the Gospel, if they are led and guided by the Spirit, as in Days of Old; the Record in Scripture is Isa. 60.11. and Isaiah see largely the further coming of Christ's Kingdom, and the powerful Effects of God's Majesty, Chap. 2.19, 21. and the great Dispensation of the Spirit of Christ Isaiah was a Witness of, Ch. 42.5. and Ch. 40.10, 11. and Ch. 61. and which Spirit should be universal, and to increase to them which are led and guided by the Spirit, the holy One in the Father, the Creator, Redeemer, and Saviour and King, Isa. 43.10. to the 16th Ver. God did not leave himself without a Witness, nor his People without a Christ to be a Guide to Israel under the Law, and the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest is in Christ and Christ in the Father, before there was a visible Man upon the Earth; and as Christ was with the Father, a Spirit in the Beginning creating, he is in his People given him of the Father to this Day, leading up the Flock, as in Days of Old he put his holy Spirit within them, and led them by the right Hand of Moses with his glorious Army, dividing the Waters before them, to get himself an everlasting Name, through the Power which God had given him, leading Israel through the Sea in a Pillar of Fire, but their holy Rest is not abolished that it should not be kept holy the Seventh Day, for Christ in Jesus did not appear in that prepared Body to lessen the Father's Honour with his own; as to the Day of his Rest commanded to be kept holy as the Lord's holy Rest after Six Days of their creating, in which he made Heaven and Earth, the Sea and the Fountains of Water, and all that in them is; but the Father giving the Son Power under the Gospel, sheweth the Works of the Power is to be observed, and hath added by the Resurrection of Jesus in the Power of God▪ an additional Day for Worship, and the Resurrection of Jesus to be held in everlasting Remembrance, in which the Works of the Power are seen, and Jesus is a holy Example, a Vail for the Word to pass through, a holy Prophet, and sent in a universal Spirit, the Morning Star in preaching and publishing the Gospel, but not to disanul the Father's Commandments. Thus to the Inquirer I declared my Satisfaction, and at length there was a Book brought to my Hand, called A Defence of the Christian Sabbath, and by this Book I understand the Question is, Whether it be the right Seventh Day in Course from the Creation? and that Records may be lost; and the Author of that Book is pleased to call it Jewish Sabbath, and Jewish Seventh Day; and upon reading the Book, the Weight of the Matter continued, and more Strength was given me to see the Sabbath is in Christ, which rested with the Father before the visible Man was formed, and there is no Sabbath out of Christ the holy Spirit, one with the Father in Spirit from the Creation, and that God which created the Day and rested in himself, gave the right Record of the Seventh Day, after the Destruction of the old World for Sin, both at the raining of Manna and the Commandments, written with the Finger of God, and given to Moses upon Mount Sinai. And upon reading the Books as aforementioned, it pleased God to give me Weight to observe the Discourse, and the Sense which God was pleased to continue to me, I was made to write in the Confirmation of the Fourth Commandment, and that the Lord's holy Rest is not abolished, nor called Jewish Seventh Day in the Commandments, nor raining of Manna; and the Commandments written with the Finger of God is to continue under the Gospel, and whilst there is an Alpha and an Omega, and Man upon the Earth, Rev. 22.13, 14. and the Lord of Hosts, the God both of Angels and Men, he will stand by them which keep their holy Rest holy; and the Lord's holy Rest is proved by Scripture to be the same from Gen. 2. to Exod. 16. and from the raining of Manna to the Commandments, because the Lord gave the Account himself by his Word to Moses to give to the People, and after the Lord had fixed the Commandments in the Peoples Hearts, and upon Tables of Stone, to be remembred, the Prophets all came in the Word of the Lord, and down to the Birth of Jesus, confirming the keeping the Lord's
holy Rest, which is a Christian Sabbath in the Dispensation of the Father, his Spirit through the Son, and the Son in Spirit through the Son of Man, and the Father and Son in Spirit, one in the Creation of Mankind, and one in Redemption; and the Four Evangelists give an Account of the crucifying that prepared Body, and waiting for the Resurrection; they all give an Account of the Sabbath the Day before the Resurrection; and, as afore-written, the Seventh Day is a Christian Sabbath to them which keep it in Christ, and Christ is the Angel of Power, the spiritual Rock which was with Moses, and all them which live, and act, and obey the Voice of the inspeaking Spirit, with holy Minds, and pure Hearts, and clean Hands, such was ever in Christ, as Christ is ever with the Father, the Word of God, but without Holiness no Man can see the Lord, nor worship the Father with Acceptance out of the Spirit of Christ, and to keep the Commandments of God, the Lord's holy Rest, as he set an Example, when this lower World was but seven Days old; and Christ is given of the Father in this universal Day, the pouring forth the Spirit upon Sons and Daughters, Servants and Hand-Maids, a Light in their People, and moves in the inward Man, which keeps their Obedience, and is leading up the Flock to the Father, as Man obeys the Voice; and the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest was a Christian Sabbath under the Law, to them that kept it in Christ the Spirit of the holy One; that is, to worship the Father in the Spirit of the Son, the one Mediator which finds Acceptance with the Father; and the Lord's Command is to obey his Voice, or he will not pardon your Transgressions, for my Name is in him, saith the Lord, and the People was to do all that the Lord spake through him, Exod. 23. and 21. and notwithstanding the Word of God, Christ the Lord, in Jesus speaking to the People of God, saying, Thine they were, and thou gavest them me, and they have kept thy Word; now they know that all Things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee, for I have given unto them the Words which thou gavest me, and they have received them, and have known surely that I came out from thee, and they have believed that thou didest send me, John 17.6, 7, 8. And yet before they were so given of the Father in the Ministration of the Gospel, Christ was leading up the Flock in Days of old, Isa. 63.9. Israel did eat their spiritual Meat and drink their spiritual Drink through Leaders, which obeyed the Voice and see their Salvation by their Obedience to the Power, and they drank of the spiritual Rock that followed them, and that Rock was Christ, 1 Cor. 10.3, 4. the People were not without a Christ to lead and guide them, nor without spiritual Meat; for, as afore-written, the Gospel Record is, Israel did all eat the same spiritual Meat, and did all drink the same spiritual Drink, they then drank of the Rock of Ages in that ministration, as many now do drink deep Draughts of that Rock and Fountain in this glorious Gospel Day, the Dispensation of both Father and Son in the Gospel of Peace, following the Example of Jesus in obedience to the Spirit, according to their Gift what is required of them; God hath not left himself without a Seed, nor are his People saved but by his Power in every Dispensation of both Angels and Men: And Jesus in Prayer to the Father saith, Glorify thy Son, that thy Son also may glorify thee, and this is Life eternal, (saith Jesus) John 17.13. that they might know thee the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom thou hast sent; and this is the great Work to this Day, to distinguish the Spirit's working in Man, so to know thee the only true God and Jesus Christ whom thou hast sent, this is Life eternal; and when any comes to distinguish the spiritual Power, which is a Voice in Man, the teaching Spirit to Salvation, such will the better see the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest is a Christian Sabbath, when Christ which ever was Spirit, rested in the Father, and the Father in him, one Spirit; and this Sabbath of their holy Rest before Sin entered the World, and to be kept in Remembrance of the sixth Day of their Creation and holy Rest, before Sin entered the World, and hath no relation to the Jews Sabbaths, given them to afflict for Sin, called their Sabbaths, nor any relation to their Carnal Ordinances and Sacrifices for Sin, these are Sabbaths given to that End, as aforementioned, and bear the Name of Jewish Sabbaths;
but the Sabbath of the Lord thy God, which thou art commanded to keep, is a holy Sabbath, and to be kept holy, as Exod. 20. sheweth; and that Chapter does not give any Authority to call the Lord's Sabbath a Jewish Sabbath, when the Lord hath called it the Sabbath of the Lord thy God, and the spiritual Male and Female, in their Likeness, and after their Image rested in Spirit with both Father and Son the seventh Day, before the visible Man of the Dust of the Ground was formed, or made Woman out of Man; their Image and Likeness was in their Rest, and the Body of Dust goes to the Grave, the Spirit, which is Man's Light and Life, returns to God which gave it, to be a Light and a Guide to Man, to lead him into all Truth; and the Dispensation of the Father is in the Son, and the Son is in Presence, the Angel of God speaking the Words of God, and visits the Seed of God, teaching the Inward Man, and the visible Man is enlightened and saved in God's Power, as he keeps his Obedience in the Growth of the Spirit, and the Father draws into the Spirit of the Son in this Gospel Day, and the Father and Son, which is the Holy Ghost, speaks in each Particular, which wait to hear the Voice of their Word; but the seventh Day of their holy Rest is not abolished, as is further shewed after six Days of their creating of the Creation, and in the room of the Jewish Sabbath, a Day to afflict their Souls for Sin, as under the Law, in the room of such Sabbaths, is the Fiery Baptism of the Holy Ghost, purging out Sin under the Gospel; and as the Fiery Baptism of the Holy Ghost purges out Sin (and gives in the Mind) Affliction for Sin, so it sanctifies the Soul into the true Rest, to keep the Lord's Sabbath of Rest holy, as owned and commanded, and this Baptism after received, is a continual Light to the Soul, and the Lord was the Sanctifier of his People under the Law, which obeyed his Voice through Leaders, (and afflicted their Souls for Sin), and the People heard the Voice of the Lord through the Fiery Pillar, that they might obey his Voice through Moses, and under the Gospel Ministration, the Spirit of Truth is heard in each Particular, convincing and shewing Men their Sin, and the Way out of Sin; and that which convinces and shews Men their Sin, is the Life and the Way to the Father, a Light shining in the Mind and Soul of Men, and the Fiery Baptism of the Holy Ghost does perform in Man the Office which them Days were appointed for to afflict the Soul for Sin, but the Lord's holy Rest, before Sin entered the World, is to be obeyed as commanded; and all Mankind are to labour to get out of Sin and to live to God in the Spirit of their Minds, and obey the Father through the Son, for the Father is the Creator, Redeemer and Saviour, which hath sent the Son to save, but never altered the Day of their holy Rest, from the seventh Day to the first Day of the Week; and no Day written by the same Finger of God, as the Commandments are, and commanded to be kept, and a Remembrance to keep the Day of his Rest holy; no Day appointed or written with the Finger of God, to be kept in the room of the seventh Day, or that the seventh Day should be abolished when the first is kept. But there are many Queries concerning the seventh Day, and that the right seventh Day is not known, because Records may be lost, and, as aforementioned, call it Jewish Seventh Day, and yet say they don't speak against the seventh Day in the Fourth Commandment; and by so saying, it may be reasonable to think such have not yet distinguished between the Lord's holy Rest and the Jews Sabbath, given them to afflict their Souls for Sin, which holy Rest was before Sin entered the World; and therefore all ought to be prepared in Holiness to keep the Lord's Rest holy, and in exercising a Day to afflict the Soul for Sin under the Law, in the room of them Sabbaths, under the Gospel Ministration, as afore-written; the Spirit of Truth is sent down to convince the World of Sin, and to shew each Particular the Way out of Sin, and to baptize the Soul into its own Spirit, and is the Truth, the Life, and the Way to the Father; and what could the Lord do more for his Creation, than send his Son, the Spirit of Truth a Light to shine in their Hearts which obeys the Voice? it leads to the Father. And now the Lord is calling to the Preachers of all sorts, to see if they
have salt in themselves to savour the Earth; and he is looking down upon all the Honest-hearted, and to be Honest-hearted is more than Form; and Men may snatch away their Society one from another, but they can't snatch away the Kingdom of God from coming to them which wait for it; and the Words of God sent down are the Keys of the Kingdom, and opens the Mysteries of the Kingdom, and an Eye to see the Wisdom and Power of God through every Dispensation and Generation and Instrument sent in the Power of God; it is one God which is the Creator, Redeemer, and Sanctifier, and Saviour; for as it is the Spirit of God which creates, so it is the Sanctifier, Redeemer and Saviour, and in Holiness there is Salvation, as the holy Example Christ in Jesus is lived to, that is, as the Spirit which acted in Jesus, and by which Spirit he spoke is lived to; and I have seen a Unity in Heaven to descend upon Men upon Earth, and Christ the Spirit of Truth will be the Leading Star in this Unity; and among every People and Nation they that fear God, and obey the Spirit's Teachings, God will work a Work in them which some will not believe, altho it be told them, but the Work will go on to the Calling the Jews and convincing the Gentiles, that all may come to see the one true God, and Christ from the Vail, and God from Man, and Flesh from Spirit, and the Messenger from the Maker, and the Land to enjoy her Sabbaths again, and Mercy is promised to Thousands, which love God and keep his Commandments, and are not found in their Father's Iniquities, and (the Commandment) in keeping their holy Rest, and to shew Love to Neighbours, and Charity to the Widows, and Fatherless, and the Stranger in the Gate; and Rest to both Son and Daughter, Servant and Cattel, was never disanul'd by neither Son nor Servant, sent in the Words of God; and it was the Will of the Holy Ghost, which sent the Prophet like unto Moses; and Jesus was anointed with the Holy Ghost, and in that Power went about doing Good, and the Holy Ghost sent forth under the Gospel universal Love, the Promise of the Father descended, which is the Holy Ghost, Acts 2.33. And the Body of Jesus being taken up, which was anointed and acted by the Holy Ghost; so the Son, one with the Father in Spirit, is seen with a spiritual Eye, leading to Holiness, by his Holy Spirit, and is calling to Men, working Peace and Reconciliation with the Father; and if Men will obey the Angelick Present, and Power given, it draws into Holiness, and Wisdom is justified of her Children, and the Work of Wisdom increase upon them, till they come to a State of a perfect Man in Christ, following Holiness; and as Christ is in God the Word of God so he visits Man in his season, and as Man grows in Grace and Truth, to see both the Father and Son, and growing in the Degrees of Grace, Life from God is given, and they are united into the Father's Love, and in the Spirit of Christ are Witnesses of the Word, which quickens, and are Spirit and Life; and the Testimony of Jesus is the Spirit of Prophecy, and both Lord and Christ was in him, he being filled with the Holy Ghost, and he manifested both Lord and Christ in the Power of the Holy Ghost, the Promise of the Father, and the Promise of the Father descended upon him, and in him and through him, before he ascended, and the Disciples were baptized of the Holy Ghost, through the Words of God which was with him; and after Jesus ascended, the Disciples were to wait for that Baptism; and the Father which sent the Son, is pleased the Son's Spirit and Word should be honoured, keeping a Day to do good Works, and to wait for the Resurrection of the Seed of Life, that they may be accepted in every good Work wrought through the Workings of the Holy Ghost, and according to the many Testimonies of Jesus; he spoke not of himself, and he proves the Prophet, which the Lord promised to send like unto Moses, speaking the Words the Lord had commanded him, Deut. 18.18. and it was the Power that spoke through the Vail, which said, I am the Resurrection and the Life, John 17.8. (it is the Spirit gives Life), and the same Power speaking through him, said, before Abraham was I am; and the Power and Spirit said, I am the Way, the Truth and the Life, and the Vail to the Word being holy and obedient in Spirit, is a Light to the World, and speaks to this Day; and the Apostles and Saints after Jesus was taken up, were known to be sanctified
Vessels, by the Works wrought through them; and the Generations keeps up Remarks of the Saints works, and keeps Days in Honour and Remembrance of them, as is farther shewed; but the Lord Sanctifier and Creator, the Day of his Rest is not kept, nor his Command obeyed, in keeping the Seventh Day; when all the Apostles, their Fasts and Feasts, are observed to be kept in their Order: as Mark the Evangelist; Philip and James the Apostles; the Ascension of our Lord Christ in Jesus; Barnabas; the Nativity of John Baptist; Peter the Apostle; James the Apostle; Bartholom • w the Apostle; Matthew the Apostle; Michael and all Angels; Luke the Evangelist; Simon and Jude the Apostle; All Saints; Andrew the Apostle; Thomas the Apostle; the Nativity of Jesus; Stephen the Martyr; John the Evangelist; Holy Innocents; The Purification of the Blessed Virgin: The Annunciation of the Virgin, after the Day of Pentecost. Now to shew that Jesus and his Disciples and the holy Women did observe to keep the Sabbath of holy Rest, notwithstanding they did desire greatly to see the Resurrection of Jesus, yet they rested the Sabbath. And Jesus that great Prophet and Son, in his Ministry and Testimony, speaking the Words of God, owned the Sabbath of Rest for Man; he said, The Sabbath was made for Man, and not Man for the Sabbath. Therefore the Son of Man is Lord also of the Sabbath, Mark 2.27. And the four Evangelists gives an Account which is the Sabbath, and which is the First Day of the Week: In the end of the Sabbath, as it began to dawn towards the first Day of the Week, came Mary Magdalen, and the other Mary, to see the Sepulchre, Mat. 28.1. Mark 16.1. And when the Sabbath was past, Mary Magdalen, and Mary the Mother of James, and Salome, had brought sweet Spices, that they might come and anoint him. And ver. 9. When Jesus was risen early, the first Day of the Week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalen, out of whom he had cast seven Devils. And Luke 23.55, 56. The Woman also which came with him from Galilee, beheld the Sepulchre, and how his Body was laid, and they returned and prepared Spices, and Ointments, and rested the Sabbath Day, according to the Commandment. And Chapter 24.1. Ʋpon the first Day of the Week, very early in the Morning, they came to see the Sepulchre, bringing the Spices which they had prepared, and certain others with them. And John 19.31. The Jews because it was the Preparation, that the Bodies should not remain upon the Cross, besought Pilate they might be token away. And John 20.1. The first Day of the Week cometh Mary Magdalen early, when it was yet dark, unto the Sepulchre, and seeth the Stone taken away from the Sepulchre. So that which is the Seventh Day, and the first Day of the Week, the Scriptures of both Old and New Testament doth clearly show. And it is written in the Account of the Creation, the six Days Work and the Seventh Day's Rest; and on the sixth Day, the spiritual Male and Female, in their Image, and after their Likeness, rested in the Lord's Rest, and remaine • in his Rest, and in the good Spirit, Gen. 1.26, 31. But the visible Man Adam, from the Dusts of the Ground, was not yet made, till after the Seventh Day's Rest, Gen. 2.1. which Dust of the Ground was another Region in the lower World; which their Image and Likeness was not: for the Record is, Chap. 2.6. There was not a Man to till the Ground; and there went up a Mist from the Earth, and watered the whole Face of the Ground. And when the visible Man Adam was made of the Dust of the Ground, the visible Woman Eve was not yet made: Gen. 2.18. The Lord God said, It is not good, that the Man should be alone, I will make him an Help-meet for him. So that the visible Male and Female was not formed, nor made till after the seven Day's Rest. And in the six Days Work, the Lord God saw every thing that he had made, and behold it was very good; and the Even and the Morning were the sixth Day, and all the Host of Heaven, and every thing upon Earth glorified God, in Purity; and on the Seventh Day God ended his Works which he had made; and God blessed the Seventh Day, and sanctified it; because that in it he had rested from all his Works which God created and made. And Man had no hand in all this Work, as Gen. 2.4. sheweth; These are the Generations of the Heavens and of the Earth, when they were created: in the Day when the Lord God made the Earth and the Heavens, and every Plant of the Field, before it was in the Earth, and every Herb of the Field before
it grew: for the Lord God had not caused it to Rain upon the Earth, and there was not a Man to Till the Ground. Notwithstanding Male and Female, In their Image and Likeness was, Gen. 1.27. God created Man in his own Image; in the Image of God created he him, Male and Female created he them. For as God is a Spirit, so their Image is Spirit, and returns to him; which the Dust of the Ground does not, as is seen it remains in the Ground; but the spiritual Male and Female never dies, but keeps his Dominion in Light and Life: And when Adam the visible Man? was formed of the Dust of the Ground, the Lord God breathed into his Nostrils the Breath of Life; and Man (in that living Seed) became a living Soul: So that the Sabbath for Divine and Spiritual Worship, was before the formed Man of the Dust of the Ground was. And it is certain, the Sabbath was made for the visible Man, and not the visible Man before the Sabbath: the seventh Day of the Lord's holy Rest, and the Creation of Angels, the heavenly Host worshipped God in Spirit (as God is a Spirit); and the Angelical spiritual Male and Female in their Image, and after their Likeness, (Light and Life) was created before the Lord's Rest, and did rest when the Lord rested, which was before the visible Man was formed of the Dust of the Ground; and this Light and Life their Image gives Presence and Life, in the visible Male and Female, and is a Seed to inlighten both Male and Female, a spiritual Seed in the Light of Christ; and this is the visible Man's Peace and Rest to this Day; as all are obedient to the Spirit, their Image and Likeness: and the Words of God is the Candle of the Lord to Man, a Lanthorn to his Feet and a Light to his Paths: And as the spiritual Worship is the first Worship, so it will be the last Worship, and he that is the Alpha he will be the Omega, the first and the last in Man's Earth: And Man and Woman joining to the good Spirit in them, are preserved by the Words of God, through the Mouth of the Seed, and the Seed visiting Seed, this Word gives Life to the Soul; and the Seed of Life, which receives the Words of God, and gives forth the Words of God, is God's Image, and after their Likeness, and never consents to sin: Notwithstanding the visible Man Adam did fall, and after the Fall of the visible Adam, the Curse and Destruction for their sakes, came upon the Earth, the old World (and the World increased again, and a righteous Seed preserved) but as the Wickedness of Man was great in the Earth; And God saw that every Imagination of the Thoughts of Mans Heart was only evil continually: and it repented the Lord that he had made Man on the Earth; and it grieved him at his Heart, Gen. 6.5, 6, 7. And as the Lord destroyed the World for Man's Wickedness, yet Noah and his Sons obtaintained the Blessing through the righteous Seed, and to be fruitful and multiply; and replenish the Earth. Gen. 9.1. And the whole Earth was of one Language, and one Speech. Gen. 11.1. And they said one to another, Let us make Brick, and build us a City, and a Tower whose Top may reach unto Heaven; and let us make us a Name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the Face of the whole Earth. And this is Man's Misery, the way which he proposes to be happy and stand fast, (but not being acted in the Counsel of God to glorify his Name) is the very way they come to be scatter'd and loose their Name. As see Gen. 11.8. And the Lord called Abram and blessed him with a Promise of Christ, and said, Get thee cut of thy Country, and from thy Kindred, and from thy Father's House, unto a Land that I will shew thee, and I will make of thee a great Nation; and I will bless thee, and make thy Name great, and thou shalt be a Blessing, Gen. 12.1, 2. And ministring Angels were sent from the Presence of God to Men, shewing his Mind and Will, as to Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and Lot, and reached to Men to inspire them with angelical Spirits, before the Law, and under the Law, and down to the Gospel of Peace, and had their Services as sent, shewing the Mind of the Spirit through Man's Mouth; and Christ was in the Bosom of the Father in the Beginning, the Spirit of Truth, the Angel of the Lord, and Son, and is with his People to this Day, and hath promised to be with his People to the End of the World; and the Dispensation of Angels glorious, which appeared to the Fathers a second Voice to confirm to do the Will of God: And after the Lord appeared to Abraham, the Angels visited Abraham, and he interceeded for Sodom; but the
number of ten Righteous Persons not being found, the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, Gen. 18.32. Then the Lord rained upon Sodom and Gomorrah, Brimstone and Fire from the Lord out of Heaven, Gen. 19.24. And after this, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, went through Nations, and sojourned, and planted Truth as they went, and the Lord appeared to them for their Incouragement, and Isaac marry'd Rebecca; and a Blessing was in the Seed, and Jacob after his Father Isaac was blessed; and God said to Jacob, arise go up to Bethel and dwell there, and make there an Altar to God, that appeared to thee when thou fleddest from the Face of Esau thy Brother, Gen. 35.1, 2. and Jacob dwelt in a Land wherein his Father was a Stranger, in the Land of Canaan, Gen. 37.1. and the Lord was with Joseph in Egypt, and blessed him there, Gen. 45.8. and after this, the Lord appeared to Moses in a burning Bush, he sendeth Moses to deliver Israel, Exod. 3.7. the Lord said, I have surely seen the Affliction of my People which are in Egypt, and have heard their Cry, and am come down to deliver them out of the Hand of the Egyptians, and to bring them up cut of that Land, unto a good Land and a large, unto a Land flowing with Milk and Honey; and great Signs and Wonders the Lord wrought through Moses to bring them out, to praise his Name, and to keep the Lords Rest and Sabbath, and the Passover is instituted, and the First-born of Egypt are slain, the Israelites are driven out of the Land, Exod. 12.31. and as the First-born of Egypt are destroyed because of Pharoah's hardness of Heart, and to shew the Lord's great Power; so the Lord spake unto Moses, saying, Sanctifie to me all the First-born, whatsoever openeth the Womb among the Children of Israel, both of Man and of Beast, it is mine, Exod. 13.1. and the Memorial of the Passover is commanded; and they took their Journey from Succoth, and encamped in Etham, in the Edge of the Wilderness; and the Lord went before them by Day in a Pillar of a Cloud, to lead them the way, and by Night in a Pillar of Fire, to go by Day and Night; he took not away the Pillar of a Cloud by Day, nor the Pillar of Fire by Night from before the People, Exod. 13.20, 22. and this the Lord's Love and settling his Sabbath of Rest, was after the destruction of the old World, and the Confusion of Babilon's Builders, and the Overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah for Sin; and the World increasing again, and God appeared again, to inform his chosen Generation what Nation they should go to, to shew forth his Power, and was a Guide to Moses, and the People, and shewed Moses where they should place his Name in Worship, and the first Day for Worship the Lord calls for after this is, to keep his Sabbath of Rest the seventh Day, and fixed Exod. 16.23. and after settled into a Commandment, and a Remembrance put upon it, Exod. 20.8, 9, 10, 11. For in six Days the Lord made Heaven and Earth, the Sea and all that in them is, and rested the seventh Day, wherefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath Day, and hallowed it; and on the sixth Day the Lord rained Manna enough for the seventh, and none descended on the seventh Day, according to the Word of the Lord which Moses gave to the People, that on the seventh Day there should be none, they should not find it in the Field; and as the Lord gave the People a Day of Rest to keep his Sabbath (not Jewish) so the Lord gave them Manna from Heaven, and this Manna was to the visible Eye, and for Bread and Food for the Body; but under the Gospel the Lord descends and rains his Spiritual Manna into the Soul, to nourish the Soul, that it may bring forth Fruit to eternal Life, not abolishing the Day of Rest in which the Father and Son rested, with their Creation, the Angelical Celestial Bodies, and the Spiritual Male and Female, and hath settled their Rest to the visible Man, and put it into a Command ••• t, and hath promised to shew Mercy to Thousands of them which love God and keep his Commandments.

There is a Dispute by a Man of outward Learning, how we shall know the right seventh Day of the Lord's Rest, from Gen. 2. to Exod. 16. and that it is the same from the raining of Manna to Exod. 20. and his Argument is, Records may be lost, and that the Lord's holy Rest is not so much as mentioned from Gen. 2. to Exod. 16. but all that question the Confirmation of the seventh Day of the Lord's holy Rest to be a Day before the first Day of the Week on which the Resurrection of Jesus was, I in all Humility desire, that those to whom
this may come, to view the Scriptures set down as afore-mentioned; and see for Mans Wickedness the whole Creation was destroyed, only a Seed preserved, and the Confusion of Babylon, and the Destruction of Sodom and Gomorrah; and as the World increased again, the Lord did appear to the Fathers Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, and they went through Nations, and Truth was planted, and the Children of Israel called out of Egypt, and delivered in the Red-Sea from the Egyptians, and Christ was their Spiritual Rock then, and led by the Right-Hand of Moses, the Lord giving Victory with his glorious Arm, and the Lord was ever fitting Man for good Works, and that he might come to keep his Rest in Righteousness, and a Seed in the faithfulness fixed, and the Lord gave the sign of Circumcision to Abraham, that they were to be circumcised in Heart and Ears, and Circumcision a Token of the Covenant between Abraham and the Lord, and to Abraham's Seed, and the Lord's Covenant and Promise is to be a God to Abraham and his Seed after him, (in Christ) Gen. 17.7. so the Lord appeared to perfect Man, and called Abraham to walk before him, and be thou perfect, ch. 17.1. and when Truth the Lord's Mind was seated in Man's Heart, and Man began to call upon the Name of the Lord, then the Lord called for his Sabbath of Holy Rest to be kept Holy, and called for a remembrance to keep it, promising all the Blessings to come upon Obedience and keeping the Lord's holy Rest; and my Call and Satisfaction is from the Lord to keep the seventh Day, the Lord's Rest; and by the first Day of the Week on which the Angel of the Lord descended from Heaven, giving a Resurrection to the Body of Jesus and by the first Day of the Week I know the seventh, and am fully satisfied with the Account the Scriptures give both in the Old Testament and the New, and that it is the right seventh Day, from Gen. 2. to Exod. 16. and from the raining of Manna to the Commandments; it is, I do firmly believe, the right seventh Day in course from the Creation, being written with the Finger of God, notwithstanding so many over-turnings, as the lower World drowned, and Registers may be lost, as some have in Print signified, and Man mistaken; but pray consider who it is appoints the Day to be kept, and gives the Account at the raining of Manna, and in the Commandments; it is he which created the Day and kept it himself; and this great Lord knew at the raining of Manna, the right seventh Day from the Creation, and from the raining of Manna to the appearing of Moses upon Mount Sinai; and this great Lord and Creator hath commanded, Six Days shalt thou Labour and do all that thou hast to do, but the Seventh Day is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God; in it thou shalt do no manner of Work, thou nor thy Son, nor thy Daughter, thy Man-Servant, nor thy Maid-Servant, nor thy Cattel, nor the Stranger that is within thy Gates; for in Six Days the Lord made Heaven and Earth, the Sea, and all that in them is, and rested the Seventh Day, wherefore the Lord blessed the Sabbath Day and hallowed it: And this great Creator giving the Account, as afore-written, he knew the right Seventh Day in Course from the Creation, and since that Time the Commandments has born Record, and the Commandments to be observed, not adding nor diminishing, and where the Lord hath recorded his Name, the Commandments stand good to this Day; and the Prophets were sent in the Words of God in every Generation, since the Commandments given to proclaim a Blessing upon the People keeping the Sabbath of the Lord thy God holy; and the Record of the Scripture is yet further; The Lord speak unto Moses saying, speak thou unto the Children of Israel, saying, verily my Sabbaths ye shall keep; for it is a Sign between me and you, throughout your Generations, that ye may know that I am the Lord that doth sanctify you, Exod. 31.13, 14. Ye shall keep the Sabbath therefore, for it is holy unto you, every one that defileth it shall surely be put to Death; for whosoever doeth Work therein, that Soul shall be cut off from amongst his People, Ver. 15. Six Days may Work be done, but in the seventh is the Sabbath of Rest, holy to the Lord; whosoever doth any Work on the Sabbath Day, he shall surely be put to Death. And, Ver. 16. Wherefore the Children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their Generation, for a perpertual Covenant, Ver. 17. It is a Sign between me and the Children of Israel for ever; for in six Days the Lord made Heaven and Earth,
and on the seventh Day he rested and was refreshed. And, Ver. 18. He gave unto Moses when he had made an end of communing with him upon Mount Sinai, two Tables of Testimony, Tables of Stone, written with the Finger of God; so this is the Lord's Day of holy Rest, the seventh Day; and the Lord's Command is to keep it holy; and the Lord which created the Days and gave the Day of his Rest as a Sign that he is a God which doth sanctify his People, he did direct Moses to the right seventh Day in Course from the Creation to the raining of Manna, and from the raining of Manna to the Commandments, and after the Commandments, as afore written, all the Prophets came in the Word of the Lord, and confirmed the keeping the Lord's holy Rest to the Appearance of the great Prophet promised like unto Moses; and the Apostles giving an Account of crucifying the Body, they all shew which was the Sabbath, (and the Word through Jesus nor his Disciples did not disanul the keeping the Lord's Rest) and the Resurrection of Jesus was on the First Day of the Week, at the end of the Sabbath, as it began to dawn towards the first Day, Matt. 28.1. And when the Sabbath was past, they brought sweet Spices, that they might come and anoint the Body, Mark 16.1, 2. Luke 23.56. They returned and prepared Spices and Ointments, and rested the Sabbath Day according to the Commandments, Luke 24.1. Ʋpon the first Day of the Week very early in the Morning, they came to the Sepulchre bringing the Spices which they had prepared, John 20.1. Thus the Gospel gives an Account both of the First Day of the Week, and the Seventh Day Sabbath, and that the First Day is at the end of the Sabbath; and the Record of all the Prophets is very punctual to keep the Lord's holy Rest, and it is a Day worthy of being kept and observed, when the great Creator hath first set an Example of keeping it himself, a Day before Sin entered the World. And when the Sabbath, and Feasts and Sabbaths are proclaimed to the Children of Israel, then also the Lord is very great in giving to Moses the Distinction of his Rest to be proclaimed from the Sabbaths and Feasts given the Children of Israel, to be a holy Convocation to afflict their Souls for Sin, and in their Feasts and Sabbaths, to do no Work in that same Day, for it is a Day of Attonement to make an Attonement for you before the Lord your God, Levit. 23.28. But these Sabbaths to afflict for Sin are abolished where everlasting Righteousness is established, and Truth the holy One seated in the Heart; and if the holy One, the Spirit of Truth be obeyed, it will make of Twain one new and living Man; and the Lord spake yet further unto Moses, saying; speak unto the Children of Israel, and say unto them, concerning the Feasts of the Lord which ye shall proclaim to be holy, Even these are my Feasts, (the Sabbath and Passover) Levit. 23.1, 2. Six Days shall Work be done, but the Seventh is the Sabbath of Rest, an holy Convocation, ye shall do no Work therein, it is the Sabbath of the Lord in all your Dwellings. And ver. 4. the Feast which the Children of Israel were to observe in their Seasons, are proclaimed also to afflict their Souls for Sin. And ver. 5. In the fourteenth Day of the Month, at Even, is the Lord's Passover. And ver. 9, 10. The Lord speak unto Moses, saying, Speak unto the Children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the Land which I shall give unto you, and shall reap the Harvest thereof, then ye shall bring a Sheaf of the First-Fruits of your Harvest unto the Priest, and he shall wave the Sheaf before the Lord, to be accepted for you: on the Morrow after the Sabbath, the Priest shall wave it. And ver. 22. When ye reap the Harvest • f your Land, thou shalt not make clean riddance of the Harvest of your Land, the Corners of thy Field, when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any Gleanings of thy Harvest, thou shalt leave them unto the Poor, and to the Stranger, I am the Lord your God. And thus the Lord's Care is to plead for the Poor, that he might bless the Land for their sakes that are poor; that none of his Creation should suffer, and the whole Family of the Earth may be helped. And now observe the Sheaf which the Priest was to wave, was the Morrow after the Sabbath. And it is to be observed again, the Morrow after the Sabbath the Gospel makes out to be the first Day of the Week: In the end of the Sabbath, (saith St. Matthew, Chap. 28.1.) as it began to Dawn towards the first Day of the Week. And to the Children of Israel, as afore-written, the Lord gave many Sabbaths to afflict for Sin, and other Sabbaths to rejoice in (besides
his holy Rest) as see Levit. 16.30. and ch. 19. the Lord calls for Holiness, and ch. 23 40. Numb. 29.7. but Sabbaths given the Children of Israel to afflict for Sin, the Prophets after Moses does not take so much notice of; for Sin remaining, the Prophet Isaiah cries out against the Sin and their Sabbaths, also of set Feasts and the New-Moon: for Sin remaining, them Sabbaths and set Feasts they became and were seen in the Abomination, as see Isaiah 1.11. to 16. their Hands was full of Blood, and they were to be wash'd and made clean, and to turn from the evil of their doings, and cease to do evil, and learn to do well; seek Judgment, relieve the oppressed, judge the Cause of the Fatherless, and plead for the Widow (not make Widows and Fatherless); Come now and let us reason together, saith the Lord, though your Sins be as Scarlet, they shall be as White as Snow; though they be Red like Crimson, they shall be as Wool; if ye be willing and obedient, ye shall eat the Good of the Land; but if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the Sword, for the Mouth of the Lord hath spoken it; and saith the Prophet, How is the faithful City become a Harlot, it was full of Judgment, Righteousness lodg'd in it, but now Murtherers; for when the Lord sent them to fight his Battles, and to destroy his Enemies, he went before them, giving Power; but when they went forth and destroyed the People as their Enemies, they became Murtherers, and the Lord would not hear their many Prayers in that State; but this does not strike at all at the Lord's holy Rest, the fourth Commandment. Hypocrisie is reproved by the Prophet, and every Prophet: but the Lord's Promises are due to Godliness, keeping the Commandments; and the same Prophet which reproves the Sabbaths of the New Moon, and their set Feasts, calls for keeping the Lord's holy Day and Sabbath, saying, If thou turn thy Foot away from doing thy pleasure on my holy Day, and call the Sabbath a Delight, the Holy of the Lord honourable, and shall honour him; not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasures, nor speaking thine own words: then shalt thou delight thy self in the Lord, and I will cause thee to ride upon the high Places of the Earth, and feed thee with the Heritage of Jacob thy Father, for the Mouth of the Lord hath spoken it: So here the Prophet in the Word of the Lord calls the Sabbath, The Lord's holy Day, in which the holy of the Lord is to be honoured; and the Lord in the Ten Commandments calls his Rest, The Sabbath of the Lord thy God; and as afore-written, I don't find the Lord's holy Day and Sabbath of Rest is called Jewish Sabbath, or Jewish seventh Day any where in Scripture, and not such a Word to be found in the Ten Commandments; and as to the Children of Israel as afore-written, they had their appointed Sabbaths and Feasts, one on the tenth Day of the seventh Month a Sabbath, and on the first Day of the seventh Month a Sabbath; a Memorial of blowing of Trumpets, an holy Conv •
cation; ye shall do no servile Work therein, (for they were at such times to look into their Souls, and depart from Sin, that it might be a holy Convocation, that their Offerings might be accepted) but ye shall offer an Offering made by Fire, Levit. 23.24, 25. Exod. 19.13. Numb. 29.1. and Levit. 23.32. In the ninth Day of the Month at Even: from Even to Even shall ye celebrate your Sabbath; and v. 36. Seven Days ye shall offer an Offering made by Fire unto the Lord; and when their Offerings in that Dispensation was accepted, the Lord descended Fire from Heaven as a sign of acceptance) but without Holiness the Offerings were not accepted, neither did Fire descend from Heaven; but Moses, to distinguish the Sabbaths given to the Children of Israel from the Lord's Sabbath of Rest, saith, Ye shall celebrate the Sabbaths from Evening to Evening; so these Sabbaths and Feasts of Charity to be given to the Poor, that the Giver might reap the Blessing of such Gifts to the Poor; and the Sabbaths given the Jews to afflict their Souls for Sin may be called the Jewish Sabbaths; but these Sabbaths given the Jews to afflict their Souls for Sin, hath no relation to the Lord's holy Rest, which was before Sin entered the World; and as afore-written, Seven Days ye shall offer an Offering made by Fire to the Lord; on the eighth Day shall be an holy Convocation unto you; and v. 37. These are the Feasts of the Lord which ye shall proclaim to be holy Convocations, to offer an Offering made by Fire unto the Lord, a Burnt-Offering and a Meat-Offering, a Sacrifice and a Drink-Offering, every thing upon his Day; and these was to be besides the Sabbath of the Lord, and besides
your Gifts, and besides all your Vows, and besides all your Free-Will Offerings, which ye give unto the Lord; and v. 39. Also in the fifteenth Day of the seventh Month, when ye have gathered in the Fruit of the Land, ye shall keep a Feast to the Lord, seven Days in the Year ye shall celebrate it, in the seventh Month; but the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest falling in these seven Days, the seventh Day is to be kept the holy Rest, and therefore the Record is, ye shall keep the eighth Day, notwithstanding the appointment yearly is but seven Days to be kept, but the Lord's Rest between makes the eighth; on the first Day shall be a Sabbath, and on the eighth Day shall be a Sabbath; so here the Law sheweth, as doth the Gospel, which is the first Day and which is the seventh fixed in the Commandments, and the other Sabbaths given to the Jews to afflict for Sin, are acknowledged to be the Laws and Sabbaths given to the Jews in that Dispensation, that they might be holy, and their Offerings pure, and tried by Fire, and owned by Fire descending from Heaven; and in the Gospel it is the fiery Baptism of the holy Ghost, that purgeth the Soul and burns up the Sin, as all are obedient to its baptizing Power; and Feasts of Charity and good Works stand good for ever, and well pleasing to the Lord, and Israel was to be distinguished from others, all that are Israelites born shall dwell in Booths seven Days, Levit. 23.41, 42. And the Lord's Care is over the Poor and Strangers, and a rejoycing and rest from Labour after the gathering in the Corn and Fruits of the Earth, Deut. 16.9. Seven Weeks shalt thou number unto thee; begin to number the seven Weeks, from such time as thou beginnest to put the Sickle to the Corn; and v. 10. Thou shalt keep the Feast of Weeks unto the Lord thy God, with a Tribute of a Free-Will Offering of thine Hand, which thou shalt give unto the Lord thy God, according as the Lord thy God hath blessed thee; and thou shalt rejoice before the Lord thy God, thou and thy Son, and thy Daughter, thy Man-servant, and thy Maid-servant, and the Levite that is within thy Gates, and the Stranger, and the Fatherless, and the Widow that are among you; and v. 12. Thou shalt remember that thou wast a Bond-man in Egypt; and v. 13. Thou shalt abserve the Feast of Tabernacles seven Days, (a Day for a Week) after that thou hast gathered in the Corn and the Wine; and v. 14. Thou shalt rejoyce in thy Feast, thou and thy Man-servant, and thy Maid-servant, Son, and Daughter, and Levite, the Stranger, the Fatherless and Widow that are within thy Gates; and v. 18. Every Man shall give as he is able, according to the Blessing of the Lord thy God which he hath given thee; so these Feasts the Lord called for, that the Poor might receive the benefit, and he accepts the Offering and Tribute of a Free-Will Offering, as if it was done to him; and Deut. 14.28. and ch. 15.11. For the Poor shall never cease out of the Land, therefore I command thee, saying, thou shalt open thine Hand wide unto thy Brother, to thy Poor, and to thy Needy in the Land: So the Lord's care is over the Poor, the Widow, and Fatherless, and Levite which had no Portion by Inheritance, and the Stranger, that they might have part at the ingathering of the Increase with the Rich, and Acts of Charity and Mercy stands good for ever; thus many Feasts the Lord appointed the Children of Israel, that they might serve the Needy among them, and reap the Blessings of Increase which the Lord blessed them with, that they might serve the Needy, besides the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest; and the •
Jews had Sabbaths given them to make an Atonement for Sin, and not to rest in Sin, nor leave Calamity upon their Souls, if they were called to the Bar of Divine Justice; and I say as the Gospel makes out the first Day to be at the end of the Sabbath, so doth the Law, The Priest was to wave a Sheaf before the Lord to be accepted the Morrow after the Sabbath; and this may tipify ano • her Sabbath to be added in the Gospel Dispensation, and so great a work in the Resurrection is worthy of everlasting remembrance, for the Power of God was seen in the Resurrection of the Body, and to wait for the Resurrection of the Seed of Light and Life in each particular, a Blessing is in it; but the first Day is not any where recorded in the Gospel a Sabbath, nor called a Sabbath, but the Lord's Rest is recorded a Sabbath in the account of crucifying the Body both in Matthew, Mark, Luke and John, as also in Gen. 2. and Exod. 16. and Exod. 20. It is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God; and as afore-written Exod. 31.18. It is written with the Finger of God; and Exod. 35.2. and Levit. 23.3. and Deut. 5.14. It
