is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God; and what Man is that upon a deliberate and second Consideration, can blot out the seventh Day, the Lord's Sabbath of Rest after six Days of his creating; and it is certain, that the Body of Jesus was raised on the first Day of the Week, and on the same Day, according to the Word of the Lord, met his Disciples, and in the same Word breathed on them and said, Receive ye the Holy Ghost, as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you; and after Jesus ascended, the Apostles were all with one accord in one place, Acts 2.2, 4. They were all filled with the Holy Ghost; and Acts 4.31, 32. And the multitude of them which believed, were of one Heart and of one Soul, that is, of one Spirit united in the Faith of the Gospel, neither said any of them, that ought of the things which he possessed was his own, but they had all things in common; and thus the great Work and Power of the Gospel went on in the Power of God, and Acts 2.44. All that believed were together, and had all things in common, and sold their Possessions and Goods, and parted them to all Men, as every Man had need; yet notwithstanding all these good Works, the Lord's Sabbath of Rest is to be obeyed, according to the Commandments and Example of Jesus, who exhorted all to keep the Commandments, and kept them himself; and the Apostles waiting to receive the Power, and set an Example of keeping the first Day of the Week, ministring the Spirit, and doing Acts of Mercy, relieving the poor Saints; and it is to the Comfort of all in the Faith of Jesus, to know a feeding of the Word of Life and Gift in the Spirit, which gives Light to the Soul, and where the Holy Ghost is given, it is a Sabbath of Rest, as in the beginning it was when Christ rested with the Father; and the same God which gives Light and Life, and descends the Gift of the Holy Ghost, he did rest the seventh Day, and set the first Example, and their Rest is commanded to be kept holy, and is not abolished; and notwithstanding the Laws of Men does not reach to cut off if they don't keep the seventh Day Sabbath of Rest, yet the Word of God stands good; the Iniquity of the Fathers is visited upon their Children that are found in the Iniquities of their Fathers, and a great cutting off there will be (as is seen in the World there is) till the Lord's Commandments is obeyed, and his holy Rest kept after six Days of their Creation; and to what purpose is it to teach the Children the Commandments of God, and say them their selves, and preach many Sermons upon that Subject, and yet not keep that Day at all; the Children of Israel had their Sabbaths as afore-written, to afflict for Sin, that they might be purified and sanctified to keep the Lord's holy Rest, and under the Gospel, the Office of Christ which rested with the Father, the Spirit of Truth is regenerating, and purging, and baptizing, and washing away the Sin, and will sanctifie the Soul, which works when the Spirit works with them, that they may be prepared to keep the seventh Day holy; and many Blessings are pronounc'd thro' all the Mouths of the Prophets, in keeping the Sabbath; and if they would not hearken to keep the Sabbath, the Prophets shewed the Evil to come, Jerem. 17.27. and the Lord hath promised to shew Mercy to Thousands of them that love him and keep his Commandments; but yet visiting the Iniquity of the Fathers upon the Children, to the third and fourth Generation of them that hate him, and are found in the Iniquity of their Fathers; for the Soul that sinneth to the end shall die, as saith the Prophets Jerem. 31.29. and Ezek. ch. 18. They shall say no more, the Fathers have eaten a sour Grape, and the Childrens Teeth are set on Edge, but every one shall die for his own Iniquity; every Man that eateth the sour Grapes, his Teeth shall be set on Edge; so he which is the Sabbath-breaker, it is his Iniquity, he is the Sinner to the Third and Fourth Generation, a breaker of the Lord's Commandments. Some argue the Law is changed; but the Answer to that is, God is not changed, and his Word is to be obey'd, and his Commandments kept, which are not abolished by his Word and Finger Writing, for the Commandments were written with the Finger of God; and till the same Finger writes to abolish the Commandment, or any part of them, they stand good: And Jesus being a Mouth to the Spirit, and waited for the Word of God which pass'd through him, and Christ spoke in him the Spirit of Truth: And in his first Sermon in the Mount,
speaking of the Light to his Disciples, sayeth, Let your Light so shine, (so they were drawn to follow him by the Spirit and Word, a Light given them to shine) before Men, that they may glorify your Father which is in Heaven, that they may see your good Works, Mat. 5.16. to the 20th. Think not that I am come to destroy the Law, or the Prophets, I am not come to destroy, but to fulfil; for verily I say unto you, till Heaven and Earth pass, one Jot or Tittle shall in no wise pass from the Law till all be fulfill'd: Whosoever therefore shall break one of these least Commandments, and shall teach Men so, he shall be called the least in the Kingdom of Heaven. And Chap. 15.3. The Scribes and Pharisees came to Jesus, saying, Why do thy Disciples trangress the Tradition of the Elders; for they wash not their Hands when they eat Bread? But the Power answer'd, Why do you also transgress the Commandments of God by your Traditions? for God commanded, saying, Honour thy Father and Mother; He that curseth Father or Mother, let him die the Death; but ye say, whosoever shall say to his Father, or Mother, it is a Gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me, and Honour not his Father or Mother, he shall be free; thus have ye made the Commandments of God of none effect by your Tradition: And notwithstanding the Lord by his Servants the Prophets, hath promised to make a new Covenant, and write his Laws in the Heart, and put his Spirit in the inward Parts, Jer. 31.33. and John 6.45. But the Lord by his new Covenant, hath not given away his Honour, nor disannulled the keeping his Sabbath and holy Rest; the great Creator of Heaven and Earth, which created all Things, the Sea, and the Fountains of Water; this the Lord's Rest is to be held in everlasting Remembrance; he is the Fountain of all Powers, Messengers and Servants, Angels and Seers; who made the great Deep to bow, and the Heavens and the Earth to tremble at his Word: And can Men, upon a serious Consideration, teach the Commandments to their Children, and say, Remember to keep the seventh Day holy, and thou shalt do no manner of Work, and yet do all manner of Work on the Seventh Day, and not keep the Day at all?

I greatly hope, when these things are consider'd, many will be pleas'd to see for themselves, and yield Obedience to the Lord's Commands, in keeping his Sabbath of Rest holy. I am not pleading for Titles, but for Holiness and Obedience; and this is the positive Command of God, Six Days shalt thou labour and do all that thou hast to do, but the Seventh is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God, in all your Dwellings, Levit. 23.2. But if the Lord is pleas'd to call for any of the Six, or for all the Six, as the Lord did in the set Feasts to be kept yearly; Seven Sabbaths shall be compleated, Levit. 23.15. and these seven Sabbaths to begin the Morrow after the Sabbath, and they were to keep the Eighth Day; because the Lord's Rest, I say, fell in between: and these seven Sabbaths may signify, that every Day should be a Sabbath of Holiness to the Soul, a Rest in God, looking over the Work of the Soul every Day, and the Mind staid upon him: but out of Labour every Day Man cannot be, for the Earth is full of Labour; and God which knew Man better than he knew himself, hath called for the Day of his Rest to be kept out of Labour in Holiness, and as aforewritten, if the Lord is pleas'd to call for the six Days to add to his mighty Works, shewing his Power from Generation to Generation; shewing the Work of the Almighty Power both in Creation and Redemption; it is he that is the Saviour and Redeemer, and King, and his mighty Power is seen both in the Dispensation of Angels, and the Ministrations of the Law; and it is his Word in the Prophets, and the Power of God is seen in descending the Power and Spirit, to visit each Particular; and notwithstanding the Dispensation of the Gospel in its Perfection, be prefer'd before the Ministration of the Law, • han Burnt-Offerings and Sacrifices: for the Power of Working in each Particular, which under the Law was only to Witnesses and Leaders, and they to perform the Justice the Law points to; yet that does make the Commandments of God of none effect, nor the First Day the Seventh; and the the Lord's Sabbath of Holy Rest was before Sin or Man was, and is still distinguish'd from all other Sabbaths and Feasts; and the Lord calls for Holiness and Perfection; but Sin remaining,
Isaiah is sent to reject their Sabbaths, to afflict for Sin and their set Feasts, as afore-written. Isaiah is sent to complain of Judah; he upbraideth their Service; he exhorteth to Repentance, saying, Your new Moons, and your appointed Feasts my Soul hateth, they are a Trouble to me, I am weary to hear them, Isa. 1.14. Ch. 32.15. And Isaiah saw largely the coming of Christ and his Kingdom, the Spirit to be poured from on high: And Malachy 3.3. expresses the Power, and Majesty, and Glory of Christ thus: And he shall sit as a Refiner and Purifier of Silver, and he shall purify the Sons of Levi, and purge them as Gold and Silver, that they may offer to the Lord an Offering in Righteousness; then shall the Offerings of Judah and Jerusalem be pleasant unto the Lord, as in the Days of old, and as in former Years, faith the Prophet; and they that offer in the Gift of God's Spirit, the baptizing Power of the Holy Ghost and its Fire, this is a pure Offering, and this Fire will consume the Sin, as Fire from Heaven did the outward Offerings, when the Offering was accepted, and this Fiery Baptism purges and makes clean the Soul; and therefore the Sabbaths to afflict the Soul for Sin, are cut off to such as live to God in the Spirit; which was to be the Effect of the outward Offering, that Men should serve God in Light and Perfection, and receive the Peace of everlasting Righteousness; but such as went on in Sin, their Sabbaths to afflict for Sin were Abomination; and their set Feasts and solemn Assemblies, and Offerings not excepted: but to the Godly, the Lord, by his Word, through any of his Prophets, never forbid the keeping of his Rest; nor is there any Day named the Sabbath of the Lord thy God under the Gospel, to be kept in the room of the Seventh; and to obey the Commandments of God is to receive Admittance into his Presence, and to observe the Work of his Power through every Instrument, Angel and Seer, in whose Power every Prophet, Angel, and Seer, came with the Words of God; and without which Power and Spirit none ought to speak; For God is a Spirit, and they which Worship him must worship in the Voice and Power of the Spirit: For when the Day of Pentecost was fully come, they were all with one accord, in one Place; and the Apostles were filled with the Holy Ghost, and speak with other Tongues, as the Spirit gave them Ʋtterance, the wonderful Works of God, Acts 2. to the 11th Verse, and Chap. 1.8. But they did not speak till the Spirit gave them utterance, and they were to wait for Power from on High. And Jesus received the Word of God, and Power in that Word, to Commission the Disciples forth in their Ministry; and called his and their Ministry, Preaching the Kingdom of God, Luke 4.43. and Mat. 10.7. And as ye go, preach, saying, The Kingdom of Heaven is at Hand; heal the Sick, cleanse the Lepers, raise the Dead, cast out Devils, freely ye have received, freely give. And being ask'd which is the first and great Commandment in the Law? his Answer is, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy Heart, with all thy Soul, and with all thy Mind; this is the first and great Commandment: and the Second is like unto it, Thou shalt love thy Neighbour as thy self; on these two Commandments hang all the Law and the Prophets, Mat. 22.36. to 40. Thus Jesus in his Ministry, directeth to love God, and that the love of God is shewed in keeping his Commandments, and not to covet any thing which is thy Neighbours. All good Works are laid up in the Commandments, Charity and Mercy; but that the Remembrance and Day of the Lord's Rest was not to be kept, it was out of Dispute amongst them gather'd to follow Jesus; the Women bring the Spices, and rested the Sabbath, Luke 23.56. according to the Commandment, as afore-written; and it is not upon Record, that Jesus, whose Example all Christians are to follow, did any Work but holy Works, as he received Power from God; neither did the Angel of the Lord descend from Heaven, to roul away the Stone on the Seventh Day, but on the First Day, Mat. 28.7. Neither is the Time of the Passover consistent with the Time of the Sabbath, because the Offering was to be ready a Lamb on the 10th Day of the Month, and the Children of Israel went out the 14th out of Egypt; and notwithstanding Jesus did say, After two Days is the Feast of the Passover, and the Son of Man is betray'd to be crucify'd: This does not contradict his rising on the First Day,
and after two Days is as many as ye can make Seven, from the Time it is spoken; and this does not alter the Seventh Day Sabbath at all, (to be kept on the First Day of the Week) because the Commandments stand good; neither does the Raising of Lazarus, as John gives the Account, after Four Days being buried, relate any Thing to the Seventh Day Sabbath, and that the Body was rais'd the Third Day, it is certain on the Sixth Day he was crucify'd and gave up the Ghost, and laid in the Sepulchre, because the Sabbath drew on (at Even) which is one Day, and resting in the Sepulchre the Seventh Day is two Days, and rising on the First Day is the Third Day, Luke 23.54. Mark 15.42. He was seen 40 Days after, until the Day he was taken up; after he, through the Holy Ghost, had given Commandment unto his Apostles, Acts 1.2. And the Word from the Holy Ghost was, Go ye therefore and teach all Nations, baptizing them in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost, teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you; and Lo! I am with you always to the End of the World. And that which continues to the End of the World, is the Word and Spirit of God; the Holy Ghost teaching and baptizing even to the Ends of the Earth. And the Disciples was to wait for the Baptism of the Holy Ghost, the Promise of the Father; Which, said Jesus, ye have heard of me, Acts 2.1, 33. and Chap. 1.4. And the Promise of the Father is the Word of Power, descending from the Father, through the Son, to the Holy Ghost, descending to visit Men, and baptize the Soul, and teach the Mind to do the Will of the Father: and in which Word the anointing Power of the Holy Ghost, Jesus went about doing Good, Acts 10.38. After Jesus was risen on the First Day of the Week, he met his Disciples and performed the Word of the Kingdom; which Word had foretold he should rise the Third Day: And when he met his Disciples on the First Day of the Week, he said, Peace be unto you; as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you, and when he had said this, he breathed on them, and said, Receive ye the Holy Ghost, John 20.21. And the Confirmation was great in the Resurrection, shewing, the Word of the Kingdom was with Jesus, according to his anointing in the Dispensation of the Spirit, the Gospel, and its Peace; and the Lord by his Power, and the Example of Jesus and his Disciples after him, hath given a loud Call to Christians in the Ministration of the Spirit, to keep the First Day of the Week in Holiness and good Works; so will the Father have his Honour, and the Son honoured in the Father's Honour. And the Work of the Power observ'd in the Resurrection of Jesus, not disobeying the Commandments, a Remembrance to keep the Lord's holy Rest holy: For he that was the First will be the Last, and his Command stands good, as afore-written; and breaking the Sabbath hath ever brought Judgment upon People and Nations; and as afore-mention'd, the Lord through Moses, and all the Prophets, hath called to keep the Seventh Day; and there is no Record that does appoint the blotting out the holy Rest, which was before Jew or Gentile by Name was upon the Earth, notwithstanding Men call the Seventh Day Jewish Seventh Day, for which there is no Record of such a Word in the Ten Commandments; and as to the other Sabbaths given the Children of Israel, to afflict their Souls for Sin, they are done away when Christ the Messias, 〈◊〉 the everlasting Passoever in Spirit, is come to his Temple to purify and cut down Sin in Man by the Sword of the Spirit, the Word of God, cleansing and purifying both Jew and Gentiles, which hearkens, and hears, and obeys the Law written in the Heart. And the same Prophet which bears Testimony to the Law that should be written in the Heart, and put in the Mind, calls to keep the Sabbath, Jer. 17.20. to the 25th Verse, and Nehem. 13.15. And the Lord's many Calls hath been for Holiness, saying, Be ye holy, for I the Lord thy God am holy; and in Holiness every Day will be a Sabbath to the Soul; but every Day, as afore-written, Man cannot be from Labour, nor in his Labour wholly have his Mind staid upon God, as he may out of Business: And the Lord, which knew Man better than he knew himself, hath called Man apart to Rest out of Labour, to serve him in Holiness, and to return to his Labour in Holiness of Mind, doing no Evil. And when Jesus came in
the Dispensation of Peace, his Message was the Word from God giving Light to the World; and he is sent to put an end to Sin, and to bring in everlasting Righteousness: And he set an Example of Holiness and Obedience, doing the Father's Will; shewing, God is a Spirit, and they which worship him must worship him in Spirit, John 4.14. And that the Work of the Spirit should be in his People as believe, as a Well of Water springing up to Eternal Life, John 7.39. And if after this manner the Christians under the Gospel, coming up in the Ranks and Degrees of Faith, can begin the Week and end the Week witnessing Peace and Rest to the Soul, giving the Father his Honour of Creation and Rest; and to Honour the Son in the Father, which gives Power to the Son: I greatly hope the others Life-Days will prove a Soul's Peace to them, with their Hands in their Labour, and to Rest with the Lord in the Inward of the Soul, is a perpetual Sabbath to the Mind; but going from Holiness which is in the pure Truth, is going from God and his Divine Law, entring Sin and Satan's dark Power, which leads to everlasting Misery, if continued in in every Dispensation. And Jesus, in the Word of God, is sent to take off the Severities of the Law, the Curse, and Oath, and Burnt-Offerings, he being the Offering for Sin to as many as follow his Example; and the Power of God descends into the Soul, and inflames the Heart in the Love of God, and preserves the Mind; and he observed the Sabbath, and went into the Synagogues, and preached; and Jesus and his Disciples reasoned with the Jews out of the Law, and preached the Word of the Gospel Inspiration: And after the Cloud receiv'd the Body of Jesus, his Disciples met on the first Day of the Week, (but never disown the Seventh Day.) And it is written, Paul preach'd unto them ready to depart, and continu'd his Speech until Midnight. And some Dispute, that from Midnight to Midnight may signify from Evening to Evening: but Jesus declaring the Calamities to come, and spake by way of Parable, he distinguished that there is an Even and a Midnight; and his Sayings are these; Watch ye therefore, for ye know not when the Master of the House cometh, at Even or at Midnight; or at the Cock crowing, or in the Morning; and exhorteth to Watch and Pray, Mark 13.35. And this sheweth, that Even is not Midnight, as also doth the killing the Passover, and the Lord's going forth at Midnight. And as Paul observ'd the First Day of the Week, he also observ'd the Sabbath, and went in among the Jews and preached in their Synagogues, and reasoned with them out of the Scriptures, Acts. 17.23, 17. But when the Persecution grew so hot, and the Jews rejected the Word of God, sent first to them; Then saith the Apostle, On the Sabbath we went out of the City by a River-side, where Prayer was wont to be made, and we sat down and spake unto the Women which resorted thither, Acts 16.13. So it is plain, the Apostles kept the Sabbath of Rest, as also met on the First Day of the Week, as Jesus met them after he was risen; and the First Day of the Week implies, there is a Seventh, and if Men may be mistaken in reckoning, because of the Destruction of the old World, and the Babylonian Captivity; yet the Finger of God which writ the Commandments, that Finger cannot be mistaken which gave the Account to Moses; and Mens Mistakes does not make more or less than seven Days to the Lord's holy Rest: and the Commandments to be recorded in every habitable Place in the Earth where the Lord records his Name: and the Lord's Mercy is great to shew Man his Duty after so many Falls; and the Destruction of the old World by Water, which is before Exodus the 16th, and then at the raining of Manna the Lord entred into Covenant again, and gave the Day of his Rest to be kept holy, and a Remembrance upon it, and who shall blot it out? It is the Lord's Sabbath, not Jewish Sabbath, and the Commandments stands good for ever, and the Signs stands good for ever to both Jew and Gentile; that it is God which sanctifies his People which follows Holiness, and the Lord's Rest is the First Day instituted for Divine Worship; and I understand Divine Worship to be spiritual Worship, and he that was the first will be the Last. And the four Evangelists give an Account, that Jesus and his Disciples, which waited for the immediate Spirit and Word, did frequently go into the Synagogues on
the Sabbath Day, and delivered their Ministry to the Jews, and Jesus was daily with them, Luke 22.53. John 18.20. Mark 14.49. and the Disciples after Jesus kept Sabbath with both Jew and Gentile, and perswaded them to continue in the Grace of God, Acts 13.42, 45, 46. and saith the Apostles to the Jews, It was necessary that the Word of God should have been first spoken to you, (as afore-mentioned) but seeing ye put it from you, and judge your selves unworthy of everlasting Life; lo we turn to the Gentiles, for so hath the Lord commanded us; and when the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the Name of the Lord; and the Word of the Lord was published throughout all the Region, but the Apostles observed the Sabbath still, Acts 16.13. and ch. 17.2. and Paul as his manner was, went in unto them, and three Sabbath Days reasoned with them out of the Scriptures but did not perswade them not to keep the Sabbath, Acts 18.4. He reasoned in the Synagogue every Sabbath, and perswaded the Jews and the Greeks; and v. 26. He spake boldly in the Synagogue; and Acts 19.8, 9. He went into the Synagogue, and spake boldly for the space of three Months, disputing and perswading the things concerning the Kingdom of God; but when divers were hardened and believed not, but spake evil of that way before the Multitude, he departed from them, and separated the Disciples; disputing daily in the School of one Tyranus; and this continued two Years; so that all them which dwelt at Asia heard the Words of the Lord, both Jews and Greeks, and God wrought special Miracles by the Hands of Paul (and to God be the Glory of all); and notwithstanding the Apostles did wait for the immediate Word, and were not to speak till the Spirit gave them utterance, and were inured with the Holy Ghost, that is, they were baptized with the Holy Spirit to speak the Word of God, and on whom the Apostles laid their Hands when that Power was upon them, they received the Holy Ghost; that is, they were baptized in Spirit to believe in the Dispensation of the Spirit and Word of God through the Apostles; yet notwithstanding the Apostles kept the Sabbath of Rest, and did not forbid that Day of Worship to neither Jew nor Gentile, for it is the first Day instituted for Divine Worship, of which the great Creator is the Example, and rested himself. And Jesus having the immediate Word with him, did observe the Sabbath of Rest, and after many Miracles wrought, went into his own Country, and his Disciples followed him; and when the Sabbath Day was come, he began to teach in the Synagogue, and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From whence hath this Man these Things? and what Wisdom is this that is given unto him, that even such mighty Works are wrought by his Hands, Mark 6.2. ch. 7.9. and Luke 4.31. and he came down to Capernaum, a City of Galilee, and taught them on the Sabbath Day, and they were all astonished at his Doctrine, for his Words was with Power; and there was some for thrusting him out of the City, v. 29. They led him to the brow of the Hill whereon the City was built, that they might thrust him down headlong; but he passing through the midst, went his way; but after they saw the Miracles wrought, they would have stayed him, that he should not depart from them, (and as Jesus was a Preacher of the Word of God) so v. 43. he saith, I must preach the Kingdom of God to other Cities, for therefore am I sent; and he preached in the Synagogues of Galilee; and Luke 5.1. The People pressed upon him to hear the Word of God. And the Apostles after the Power ascended, and Jesus was received into the Cloud, the Apostles waited for the descendings of the Power, and met together on the first Day of the Week; but neither Jesus which preached the Kingdom of God, nor his Disciples preaching the Word of the Kingdom, ever in any of their Doctrines disowned the Sabbath of holy Rest, but observed it, and preached the Kingdom of God in the Synagogues; and as Jesus had given the Word of the Kingdom to his Disciples, fore-shewing the Resurrection; and when the Word of the Kingdom of God was performed, it was a great confirmation to his Disciples and Followers, which waited for the performance of the Kingdom of God, and they were inspired as they waited to see that Word fulfilled, and received Power to go on in the Work of God, but not to take up a Rest in the Flesh, for that is not the Christian Warfare in neither Law nor Gospel, and they delivered their Testimonies with the hazard of their Lives; under both Law and
Gospel, they had Trial of cruel Mockings and Scourgings, of Bonds and Imprisonments, they were stoned, sawn asunder, tempted, slain with the Sword, they wandered about in Sheep-Skins and Goat-Skins, being destitute, tormented, of whom the World was not worthy, they wandered in Desarts, and in Mountains, and in Dens and Caves of the Earth, Hebrews 11. So notwithstanding the Work of the Gospel is great, and Jesus and his Disciples their Sufferings were great, in setting an Example of Peace; yet they were not to take up a Rest in the Flesh till the Work in the Spirit was done; and when Nations come to live to and in the Peace of the Gospel, according to their Example, they will honour the Father and Son in one Spirit, as they are one in Spirit; so when Christ has gathered Man into his Spirit, to worship the Father in Spirit and in Truth, then he will present the Church in the Unity of the Spirit to the Father of Spirits; and this Son is the express Image of his Father's Person, the Spiritual Rock, Corinth. 10.4. and the Body of Jesus a Vail to the Spirit, and Christ the Lord is within the Veil, and is Spirit and Life, and the Babe a Sign lying in the Manger, and in this glorious Dispensation the Work of the Holy Ghost is seen, the Father through the Son to be Spirit, and none knows the Father but the Son which is Spirit, and they to whom the Son will reveal him; and the Son which reveals the Father is Spirit, as the Father is Spirit, and the Father is the one God, the one Almighty Power both in Creation and Redemption; and Gifts to Men are given of the Holy Ghost, both Father and Son which are Spirit, and draws in to the Work of the Spirit, and in which Spirit Jesus was anointed with the Holy Ghost, Acts 10.38. and went about doing good; and spake the Words from God as the Spirit gave him utterance; so the Work of Creation, and the Dispensation of Angels before the Law and in the Law, and the Work of the Gospel, and the Examples of Peace is very great, but not put in practice; and he which is the Creator, is the Redeemer, and Sanctifier, and Saviour; and to each Work the Lord hath given a Day, first a Day of Remembrance upon his holy Rest, and through the Works of the Power, the Angel of the Lord descending, and gave a Resurrection to the Body, a Work which is worthy of remembrance, and Christians are to wait for Light and Life which the Power gives, and each particular to wait for a Resurrection in that Seed which gives Life, to hear the Voice of God speaking in their Souls (as it did in Jesus,) that they may be the Disciples of Christ, in the Power and Spirit which hath called them to live in the Truth and Peace of the Gospel; for as the Gospel is Peace, so the Severities of the Law is taken off to them which live in Christ, and are disciplin'd under the Gospel Spirit, according to the Examples of Jesus and the Disciples, and Laws and Oaths, and Sword and Force which was under the Law, are taken off under the Gospel, and to serve the Lord with Holyness and Peace, and Long-suffering till the Gospel is established through Nations, in that Peace which humbles Christians, and teaches them to do the Will of God in his Season; and the seventh Day, as afore-mentioned, hath never been disannull'd by the same Finger of Power which writ the Commandments, nor hath it been disannull'd through Jesus, nor his Disciples which preached the Word of God; the Word of the Kingdom, and the Father the Creator of all Things ought to be obeyed, and his Commandments kept from Generation to Generation, and through Nations where the Lord's Name is recorded; and to teach the Children to say the Ten Commandments, and to say, Remember to keep the seventh Day holy, it is the Sabbath of the Lord thy God, and yet not keep it at all, and so say and not do to the end of their Days, through Generations and Nations; and for these Things, disobeying the Commandments, and not living in the Peace of the Gospel, shewing Love to Neighbours, the Lord's Controversie is with Nations, and this Nation in particular, because of its great Light, and many have been and still are in the profession of the Light, but not living in the Peace of the Gospel, nor to the Commandments of God, in shewing Love to Neighbours, the Light of many is and will be made dark, and the Judgment will come heavy to those that are not pitiful and merciful; and the Example of the Apostles is to do good Works; they met on the first Day of the Week, and
gave Orders to the Churches of Galatia, upon the first Day of the Week, let every one of you lay up by him in Store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gathering when I come, 1 Cor. 16.2. and they did continue daily with one accord in the Temple, and breaking Bread from House to House, (or at Home) did eat their Meat with gladness and singleness of Heart, praising God, and having favour with all the People, and the Lord added to the Church such as should be saved, Acts 2.46, 47. and the Lord is the same to this Day, adding to the Church such as live in the Truth; and it is recorded, John was in the Spirit on the Lord's Day; and some will have it, the first Day is meant the Lord's Day, but that part of Scripture does not say, whether it were the first Day or the seventh Day which John was in the Spirit, but the Voice was from him which is the first and the last, Revel. 1.10, 11. and he that is the first and will be the last, hath called the seventh Day his holy Day; and this John saw, the Dragon was wroth with the Woman, and went to make War with the remnant of her Seed, which kept the Commandments of God, and have the Testimony of Jesus Christ, ch. 12.17. and ch. 14.12, 7. Here is the patience of the Saints, here are they that keep the Commandments of God and the Faith of Jesus; and the loud Voice of the Angel which had the everlasting Gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the Earth, and to every Nation, and Kindred, and Tongue, and People is, Fear God and give Glory to him, for the Hour of his Judgments is come, and worship him that made Heaven and Earth, and the Sea, and the Fountains of Waters; and after this Description of the Angel, to worship him that made Heaven and Earth, there is reason to believe, it was the Lord's Rest that John was in the Spirit, the seventh Day, since the loud Cry of the Angel which had the everlasting Gospel to preach, is to give worship to him which made Heaven and Earth, and the Sea, and the Fountains of Waters, which Worship is due to none but the Almighty, which bears Rule by his invisible Power over the Kingdoms of Men which dwell upon the Earth; and as the Lord by Wisdom made the Worlds, he hath been so merciful to call Man and Woman to keep their Rest, and Rest for the Cattle, that there might be a true Rest throughout the earthly Part of Men; and to be holy, that they may receive the Fruits of Holiness, and shew Mercy to all, and the Holy Seed is ever at Rest in the Spirit, when God which is their Light is glorified; the Lord hath enlighten'd Man's Dust, and beautified it with their own Image and Likeness, to be a Light in Man, that Man may work the Work of the Day as the Spirit works in him, the Spiritual Male and Female never consents to Sin, but reproves Sin in the inward Man; and well would it be if all that own the Name Christian, and record his Name, and also own the Commandments should be kept, if they were obedient to the peaceable Faith they profess, it would give a great Light in the World, and the Days are to be called as the Lord hath called them, as First, Second and Third, Fourth and Fifth, Sixth and Seventh Day, and because the Days are not called as the Lord hath called them, therefore Multitudes in every Nation are to seek to know the Holy Rest, but call it as the Heathens have given it a Name Saturday, and many neither keep the seventh nor the first, according to the Works of the Power both in Creation and Redemption; and if the Days were called as the Lord hath called them, it might bring a Sobriety over many more, to see the great Works of Creation, and to look into the Beauty of every Leaf and Plant of the Field, and for Man to see his own nothingness, and what he is in God is his great Advantage.

There is some which observe the Evening and the Morning is not so much as mentioned to the seventh Day, and whether the beginning and end of the seventh be the same with the other six; and he seems to question, whether the seventh takes its entrance at Sun-set the sixth Day? I have only this to say, as the Scripture gives the Record, the Evening and the Morning is for six Days, and the seventh hath its Time and Light in course, or else the first Day again must be out of its course, and then there is no knowing the seventh part of Time; and it may be seen, the seventh begins and ends like the other six; and there is a Question proposed, Whether the Lord sanctified the whole Day, or a part for Worship? But the Scriptures are plain, God blessed the seventh Day and sanctified it, because in it he had rest;
and to me it is most sure, that God which created all things, did begin and end the seventh according to his own appointment of the other six for it has its Evening and its Morning; and some in contradiction to the Sabbath of Rest, taking its entrance at the setting of the Sun on the sixth Day, they observe there was no Sun for three Days, which is true; but if they please to observe again, there was a Sun, Moon and Stars created the fourth Day before the Lord's Rest, which is no Argument the Sabbath may not begin at Sun-set at the end of the sixth Day; and notwithstanding for three Days the Evening is not distinguished by the setting of the Sun, yet it is said to be the Evening and Morning is the first, and second, and third Day, and Sun and Moon and Stars was after made, and the two great Lights set in the Firmament of Heaven, to give Light upon the Earth, and to divide the Day from the Night, and for Signs and for Seasons, and for Days and Years; but the Evening, at the going down of the Sun, comes to be the better known to poor Mortals, after the Sun is set in the Firmament of Heaven, not but it was the Evening and the Morning, concludes the Day before the Sun was set in the Firmament, and the Evening was, and the Morning was and is recorded the Day, but the Sun in its appearance, rising and setting, distinguish the Mid-day and Evening better than for three Days, when there was no Sun appeared, to shew the distinction of Evening and Morning, and Mid-day, as the Sun passeth through the Circuit of Heaven; and that ye may be assured the Evening and the Morning compleats the Day, as well as when there was a Sun, it is so mentioned for six Days, and the Evening and the Morning is the Rule to know the Day in every Climate and habitable Place of the Earth, where the Lord recorded his Name; and the Sun sheweth (as afore-written) a Noon or Mid-day, and Afternoon, and shews its drawing to the West, in its Hours and Time, the Day being long or short in every Climate; and the Question is put by a Master of Art, whether it was Day-light all at one Minute all over the World? To which the Scriptures are silent, and many Places were not found out to give an Account of; and it may be seen, the Day breaks gradually, and the Clouds disappear, and the Morning grows brighter and brighter, and the Night Stars disappear, and the bright Star of the Morning appears, till the Sun with its Glory over-shadows that Star with its bright Beams; and there is degrees of dispersing the Curtains of Heaven, and the rising of the Morning and its Light; and this is plain, and a Rule set down, and in every habitable place of the Earth, the Evening and the Morning are the recorded Day, and Men are to be informed by the Power of God and his Signs in the Heavens what by Learning they have not attained to; but Men nor Angels have not been sent to turn the seventh Day into the first, and so turn the Rest of the Lord thy God, and the Worship due to his Rest out, and not keep it at all; and this Master of Art declares, he will not undertake to say what shall become of the seventh Day; that of the fourth Commandment, the seventh Day after six of Labour, (and yet every where in his printed Book argues against keeping the seventh Day, calling it Jewish Weekly Sabbath) which I am (saith he) fain to mention so often in defence of my self and others, because where you find any to mention, that the Weekly Sabbath or Seventh Day Sabbath, meaning that of the fourth Commandment, is not abolished, you presently catch at it, as if I spoke it of the seventh Day, that of the Jews, from the first raining of Manna; whereas you know, that even those who thus speak, do constantly maintain, that the Jews seventh Day was exchanged for the Lord's Day, which is a Weekly Sabbath, as well as that of the Jews (saith he); to this it is often already said, The Lord's Sabbath of Holy Rest was before Jew or Gentile by Name was; and at the first raining of Manna it was the Lord's holy Rest, not Jewish Sabbath; and all that come to be holy, have a Call into that Rest, and it was given the Church to keep as the Lord's holy Rest, and is the same with the fourth Commandment; and Nehemiah gives the Account, it was the Lord came down upon Mount Sinai, and madest known unto them his holy Sabbath, and gave them Bread from Heaven for their Hunger, and broughtest forth Water out of the Rock for their Thirst, and promised them that they should go in to to possess the Land which thou
hadst sworn to give them, Nehem. 9.13. and when they were entered the Land, If the People of the Land bring Ware or any Victuals on the Sabbath Day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on the Sabbath, ch. 10.30, 31. and the Rulers and People entered into a Covenant and Oath, to walk in God's Ways, and to observe and do all the Commandments and his Statutes, and that we will not give our Daughters to the People of the Land, nor take their Daughters for our Sons; and Nehemiah makes a distinction between the Lord's Sabbath and the other Sabbath, in giving such a particular Charge and holy Care to observe the Lord's Sabbath of Rest; and all the Prophets, after Moses, doth proclaim the Lord's Sabbath before all other Sabbaths, and saith, Nehem. 13.15. to 22. In those Days saw I in Judah some treading Wine-Presses on the Sabbath, and bringing in Sheaves, and lading Asses; as also Wine, Grapes and Figs, and all manner of Burdens, which they brought in to Jerusalem on the Sabbath Day; and I testified against them in the Day wherein they sold Victuals. There dwelt Men of Tire therein, which brought Fish and all manner of Ware, and sold on the Sabbath unto the Children of Judah and in Jerusalem. Then I contended with the Nobles of Judah, and said, What evil thing is this that ye do, and profane the Sabbath Day; did not your Fathers thus, and did not our God bring all this Evil upon us, and upon this City? yet ye bring more Wrath upon Israel by profaning the Sabbath. And it came to pass that when the Gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the Sabbath, I commanded the Gates should be shut, and I charged they should not be opened till after the Sabbath; and some of my Servants set I at the Gates, that there should no Burden be brought in on the Sabbath Day. So the Merchants and Sellers of all kind of Ware lodged without Jerusalem once or twice; then I testified against them and commanded the Levites they should cleanse themselves, and come and keep the Gates and sanctify the Sabbath; and Jeremiah the Prophet gives in his Testimony in the Word of the Lord for keeping the Sabbath, saying, Thus saith the Lord unto me, Go and stand in the Gates of the Children of the People, whereby the Kings of Judah come in, and by which they go out, and in all the Gates of Jerusalem, and say unto them, Hear ye the Word of the Lord, ye Kings of Judah, and all the Inhabitants of Jerusalem that enter in by these Gates, thus saith the Lord, Take heed to your selves, and bear no Burthen on the Sabbath Day, nor bring in by the Gates of Jerusalem, neither carry forth a Burthen out of your Houses on the Sabbath Day, as I commanded your Fathers, but they obeyed not, neither inclined their Ear, but made their Neck stiff, that they might not hear nor receive Instructions, (so they were to take heed to themselves that they did not any of these things, which would lead in Judgments and the violence of War upon them) and it shall come to pass, if ye diligently hearken unto me, saith the Lord, to bring in no Burthen through the Gates of the City on the Sabbath Day, but hollow the Sabbath Day to do no Work therein, then shall there enter into the Gates of the City, Kings and Princes sitting upon the Throne of David, riding in Chariots and on Horses, they and their Princes, the Men of Judah, and the Inhabitants of Jerusalem, and this City shall remain for ever, but if ye will not hearken to me, to hallow the Sabbath Day, and not to bear a Burthen even entering in at the Gates of Jerusalem on the Sabbath Day, then will I kindle a Fire in the Gates thereof, and it shall devour the Palaces, and it shall not be quenched, Chap. 17.19. to the end of the Chapter; and Ezekiel repeats the Lord's Complaint against Israel, the Rulers Rebellion, and saith the Lord by the Mouth of Ezekiel, I gave them my Statutes, and shewed them my Judgments, which if a Man do, he shall even live in them; moreover I gave them my Sabbaths, to be a Sign between me and them; but the House of Israel rebelled against me in the Wilderness; they walked not in my Statutes, and they despised my Judgments, which if a Man do he shall even live in them; and my Sabbath they greatly polluted: Then I said, I would pour out my Fury upon them in the Wilderness to consume them, but I wrought for my Names sake, that it should not be polluted before the Heathen, in whose sight I brought them out; yet also I lifted up my Hand to them in the Wilderness, that I would not bring them into the Land which I had given them, flowing with Milk and Honey, which is the Glory of all Lands; because they despised my Judgments, and walked not in my Statutes, but polluted my Sabbaths, for their Hearts went after their Idols; nevertheless mine Eye spared them from destroying them, neither did I make an end
of them in the Wilderness: But I said to their Children in the Wilderness, Walk ye not in the Statutes of your Fathers, neither observe their Judgments, nor defile your selves with their Idols; I am the Lord your God, keep my Judgments and do them, and hallow my Sabbaths; and they shall be a Sign between me and you, that ye may know that I am the Lord your God; notwithstanding the Children rebelled against me, they walked not in my Statutes, neither kept my Judgments to do them, which if a Man do, he shall even live in them; they polluted my Sabbaths: then I said, I would pour forth my Fury upon them, to accomplish my Anger against them in the Wilderness, because they had not executed my Statutes, and had polluted my Sabbaths, and their Eyes were after their Fathers Idols, Ezek. 20.12. to 25. Thus the Prophets were all sent in the Word of the Lord one after another, to testify both against Prince and People that break his Covenant; and Isaiah in the Word of the Lord saith, Keep ye Judgment and do Justice, for my Salvation is near to come, and my Righteousness to be revealed; blessed is the Man that doeth this, and the Son of Man that layeth hold on it, that keepeth the Sabbath from polluting it, and keepeth his Hands from doing any evil. Neither let the Son of the Stranger that hath joined himself to the Lord, speak, saying, The Lord hath utterly separated me from his People; neither let the Eunuch say, Behold, I am a dry Tree; for thus saith the Lord unto the Eunuch that keep my Sabbaths, and choose the Things that please me, and take hold of my Covenant, even to them will I give in mine House, and within my Walls, a Place and a Name better than of Sons and Daughters; I will give them an everlasting Name that shall not be cut off. Also the Sons of the Stranger that join themselves to the Lord, to serve him, and to love the Name of the Lord, to be his Servants, every one that keepeth the Sabbath from polluting it, and taketh hold on my Covenant, even them will I bring to my holy Mountain, and make them joyful in my House of Prayer, Isaiah 56.1 to 7. So here the Scripture sheweth, none is shut out from the Lord, and his People that keep his Sabbath holy, the seventh Day after six of Labour, and them that keep the Lord's Sabbath, not doing any Evil, are joined to the Lord in Worship, and he has promised to give them a Name better than of Sons and Daughters, and bring them to his holy Mountain; and all that appear in the Gift of his Presence they know his holy Mountain; and when the Lord's Presence visits them they know a Peace-Offering; but from Genesis to the last Chapter of the Revelations, there is not any Scripture forbids the keeping the Commandments of God; and he that was the first, will be the last, and the Day of his Rest will stand for ever among the Angelical Spirits; and he that createth and governs the World and all Things by his mighty Power, will gain the Victory over the World and its Wars; and the Lord by Ezekiel sheweth a Catalogue of Jerusalems Sins, which were in her before the Judgments came upon her, and proved their Ruin, and saith the Prophet, Behold, the Princes of Israel every one were in thee to their power to shed Blood; in thee have they set light by Father and Mother; in the midst of thee have they dealt by Oppressi • n with the Stranger; in thee have they vexed the Fatherless and the Widow; thou hast despised my holy Things, and hast prophaned my Sabbaths; in thee are Men that carry Tales to shed Blood; in thee they eat upon the Mountains; in the midst of thee they commit Lewdness; in thee they discover their Fathers nakedness; in thee have they humbled her that was set apart for Pollution; and one hath committed Abomination with his Neighbour's Wife, and another hath lewdly-defiled his Daughter-in-Law, and another in thee hath humbled his Sister, his Father's Daughter; in thee have they taken Gifts to shed Blood; thou hast greedily gained of thy Neighbour; therefore thus saith the Lord God, because ye are all become Dross, behold therefore I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem, as they gather Silver, and Brass, and Iron, and Lead, and Tin, into the midst of the Furnace, to blow the Fire upon it, to melt it; so will I gather you in mine Anger and in my Fury, and I will leave you there and melt you; yea, I will gather you and blow upon you in the Fire of my Wrath, and ye shall he melted in the midst thereof, and ye shall know that I the Lord have poured out my Fury upon you, Ezek. 22.6. to the 12 ver. and from 19 to 23. and ver. 27. Her Princes in the midst thereof are like Wolves ravening the Prey to shed Blood, and to destroy Souls to get dishonest gain; and her Prophets had daubed them with untempered Morter, seeing Vanity, and divining Lies unto them, saying, Thus saith
the Lord, when the Lord hath not spoken; and the Prophets which so daub with their untempered Morter, they are Murderers of Souls, of both Prince and People; ver. 29. The People of the Land have used Oppression, and exercised Robbery, and have vexed the Poor and Needy; yea, they have oppressed the Stranger wrongfully; and I sought for a Man among them that should make up the Hedge, and stand in the Gap before me for the Land, that I should not destroy it, but I found none; therefore have I poured out mine Indignation upon them, I have consumed them with the Fire of my Wrath, their own Ways have I recompenc'd upon their Heads, saith the Lord; and for these Sins remaining and reigning, the Anger of the Lord is poured forth from Generation to Generation; and when the Measure is full in every Generation, and the Iniquity is at the heighth, as it now makes its appearance, for which the Lord is visiting the World with his Judgments; and the Lord hath ever shewed his displeasure for Sin and breaking his Sabbath, for the Lord will be glorified in all his Works; and many Threatnings are to them which keep not his Covenant, as many are the Blessings promised to them that love God, and keep his Commandments of Mercy and Peace; and saith the Lord by Moses, If ye walk in my Statutes and keep my Commandments and do them, then will I give you Rain in due season, and the Land shall yield her Increase, and the Trees of the Field shall yield their Fruit, and your Threshing shall reach unto the Vintage, and the Vintage shall reach unto the sowing Time; and ye shall eat Bread to the full, and dwell in your Land safely, and I will give you peace in the Land, and ye shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid; and I will rid evil Beasts out of the Land, neither shall the Sword go through the Land. I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and establish my Covenant with you, and ye shall eat old store, and bring forth the old because of the new; and I will set my Tabernacle amongst you, and my Soul shall not abhor you, and I will walk among y • u, and will be your God, and ye shall be my People; but if ye will not hearken unto me, and will not do all these Commandments; and if ye will despise my Statutes, if your Souts abhor my Judgments, so that ye will not do all my Commandments, but that ye break my Covenant; I also will do this unto you, I will even appoint over you Terror, Consumption and the burning Ague; and ye shall sow your Seed in vain, for your Enemies shall eat it; and I will set my Face against you, and ye shall be slain before your Enemies, they that hate you shall reign over you; and if ye will not for all this hearken unto me, then I will punish you seven times more for your Sins; and I will break the Pride of your Power; and I will make your Heavens as Iron, and your Earth as Brass, and your Strength shall be spent in vain; for your Land shall not yield her Increase, neither shall the Trees of the Land yield their Fruits; and if ye will walk contrary unto me, and will not hearken unto me, I will bring seven times more Plagues upon you, according to your Sins; and I will bring a Sword upon you that shall avenge the Quarrel of my Covenant, Levit. 26. from the 3d to the 26th ver. and if ye will not for all this hearken unto me, but walk contrary unto me, then will I walk contrary unto you also in Fury; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your Sins; and Moses sheweth wherein the Blessings are to the obedient, and the Judgments to the disobedient that keep not the Commandments of God; and the Judgments appointed for Sin will be poured forth under the Gospel Dispensation (as under the Law), when the Measure of Iniquity is full, it will come even to this Generation, the Judgments stands at the Door and is entering our Land, and this our Land will enjoy her Sabbaths as long as it lieth desolate, and ye be in your Enemies Land (as it was said to the Children of Israel), then shall the Land rest and enjoy her Sabbaths, as long as it lieth desolate it shall rest, because it does not rest in your Sabbaths: for not only was the Desolation to come upon the Children of Israel, which liv'd after the Flesh, but upon every Generation will the Desolations come, which obey not the Commandments of God, and disobey the Covenant of Light; which Commandments and Covenant of Light is perpetual, whilst the Sun and Moon endures; for God, which gave the Commandments, is the Light, and will continue the Light to all that obey the Voice: and not one Word in the Commandments (as afore written) is contrary to the Peace of the Gospel, and its Power and good Spirit teaching Obedience in the Power of the Holy Ghost,
which gives a Visitation in the Spirit, descended down of both Father and Son, to inlighten each Particular, that waits for that Spirit of the Son which leads to the Father, and gives entrance into the Kingdom of Light, which leads to Life; and as the Soul is beautified with Holiness, Christ will raign in his Kingdom of Peace, and till People and Nations come to keep the first Step in Religious Worship, of which the Lord hath set the Example, and hath put it into a Command, if Men will not take the great Creator for an Example, and join with him in Worship, then the Sword will not depart such a Nation, and they will be yet punished for their Iniquities. And Isaiah, which had a great Foresight of Christ's Kingdom, and was made a Minister of Christ, and spake when the Spirit was upon him: and after he had reproved the Rulers for keeping the Sabbath of the New Moon and set Feasts, their Sin remaining, and their Hands were full of Blood; and for that Cause their Sins remaining, their Oblation was an Abomination, and rejected; and yet, after such Reproofs to them for such Assemblies, the same Prophet calls to the rising Generations, in the Word of the Lord, to keep the Lord's Sabbath, and join to the Lord, and gives Incouragement; and that the Eunuch, nor the Sons of the Stranger shall not be rejected, but received into the Church, and in Holiness joined to the Lord; and under the Gospel, Without Holiness none can see the Lord. And all Nations are to bring their Offerings to the new and spiritual Jerusalem, were God and the Lamb are the Temple of it, and the Light of the Holy City to the Pure in Heart, that eye Peace in all its Circumstances: and to be clear of the Blood of all Nations, which live carelesly, and in the Bitterness one to another, till their Measure of Iniquity is full, and then the Lord will send his Sword; and when the Sword of the Lord enters the Land and his fierce Anger appears, he hath many ways to destroy, and many sorts of Armies to call for, which Men can't contend with: notwithstanding it be but Flies and Worms, and the poor creeping Caterpillars, or the biting Serpent; there is no hiding from his Presence: The Lord God of Hosts is he that toucheth the Land and it shall melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: It is he that buildeth his Stories in the Heavens, and hath founded his Troops in the Earth; he that calleth for the Waters of the Sea, and poureth them out upon the Face of the Earth; the Lord is his Name, Amos 9.5, 6. and Jer. 29.17. And the Lord will distress them which distress Sion, and will gather his Israel, (notwithstanding Israel, after the Flesh) is to be sifted as in a Sive, that the pure Seed and Grain may appear to worship him, and keep his Sabbath: and the Lord's Promise is, not one Grain the less shall not fall upon the Earth of this pure Seed; but this Promise is not to the Sinners: All the Sinners of my People shall die by the Sword, which say, The Evil shall not overtake nor prevent us: In that Day will I raise up the Tabernacle of David that is fallen, and close up the Breaches thereof, and I will raise up his Ruins, and will build it, as in Days of old, that they may possess the Remnant of Edom; and all the Heathen which are called by my Name, saith the Lord of Hosts, that doeth this.

Thus the Lord hath promised to bring again the Captivity of his People Israel; And I will plant them upon their Land, and they shall no more be pulled up out of their Land which I have given them, saith the Lord thy God, Amos 9.9. to the end of the Chapter. Thus Man's planting will be brought to nought, and their Vine and Vineyard destroyed, till the Lord of Host raign in Sion, and Christ's Kingdom of Peace is established: And the Lion come to lie down with the Lamb, and the Wolf also shall dwell with the Lamb, and the Leopard shall lie down with the Kid; and the Calf, and the young Lion, and the Fatling together, and a little Child shall lead them; and the Cow and the Bear shall feed their young ones, shall lie down together; and the Lion shall eat Straw like the Ox, and the sucking Child play on the Hole of the Asp; and the weaned Child shall put his Hand on the Cockatrice Den. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy Mountain; for the Earth shall be full of the Knowledge of the Lord, as the Waters cover the Sea, Isa, 11.6. to Verse 10. and Chap. 65.25. Thus the Prophet having a great Sight of the peaceable Kingdom of Christ, he begins and ends with Peace; shewing, the angry, and fierce, and poisonous Nature is done away in the Peace of Christ's Kingdom. And after the Prophet, in the
Word of the Lord, had reproved the Rulers and People in a shew of Worship, when their Hands were full of Blood, and in that State the Lord would not hear their Prayer, Isa. 1.15. and Chap. 1.4. the Prophet prophesieth the further coming of Christ's Kingdom; he exhorteth to Fear, because of the powerful Effects of God's Majesty; and in the Word which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem: And it shall come to pass in the last Days, that the Mountain of the Lord's House shall be established in the top of the Mountains, and shall be exalted above the Hills, and all Nations shall flow unto it: And many People shall go and say, Come ye, and let us go up to the Mountain of the God of Jacob, and he will teach us of his Ways, and we will walk in his Paths: for out of Sion shall go forth the Law, and the Word of the Lord from Jerusalem. And he shall judge among the Nations, and shall rebuke many People, and they shall beat their Swords into Plow-shears, and their Spears into Pruning Hooks; Nation shall not lift up Sword against Nation, neither shall they learn War any more: O House of Jacob come ye, and let us walk in the Light of the Lord, as saith the Prophet Micah in the Word of the Lord, Chap 4. to Ver. 4. In which Word there is Majesty, and Majesty is in the Spirit sent forth to both the Rulers and People, to reprove their Evils, and to give right Judgment to rule the People in that Word: for Majesty is not in the bodily Presence which is clothed with Flesh, but the spiritual Presence which was with Moses, Exod. 33.14. Majesty is the pure Grace which represents the Person of God by his spiritual Voice in Man, Exod. 18.15. and there is Majesty in them Words, and out of this Grace Mens Words are nothing of force to savour the earthly part of Men to Salvation; and when the Words are savour'd with Grace, there is a meek Majesty appears from the one Lord God, the good Spirit, the Holy Ghost, both Father and Son, one in Spirit, giving Life and Light to Men, and therefore are the one God which comes in their glorious Persons, shining in their glorious Apparel, and the Saints in Light they behold them; and when ye hear the Majesty on high, pray don't ye go on in the opposition, as some present upon the Earth have done, when the Word was made manifest in its Time to them. And now a further Manifestation is given in the Gospel, which is, Peace and Good-Will to all Men, waiting for the Grace and good Spirit; and shewing the Sabbath of holy Rest is in Christ under both the Law and Gospel; and that the Lord's Sabbath of holy Rest doth not end in Christ, the Sabbath is in Christ which rested with the Father, after six Days of their Creation; and that prepared Body, Jesus of Nazareth, a Sign of the Substance within the Veil, and a blessed Sign too, shewing forth the Works of the Spirit to the obedient Soul, waiting for the Consolation of Israel, and for the coming of that Glory and true Rest to the World, that Nations may rest in Peace. But Oh! how dreadful it is, almost all Nations are in Blood and Confusion, to the Shame of Christianity; which is, Love and Meekness, and Good-Works, and Long-sufferings, and Patience; for the Life of Man is but as a Span long, and in that space of Time, to shew Mercy, and do Justice; for all must appear before the great Judge of all the Earth. And this Word came to me the 30th Day of the 10th Month 1715-6. The Lord will weigh the Nations as in Scales, and the Hills and the Mountains shall know that he hath created the Valeys, as also the highest Mountain and Hill; and he will thresh the Mountains and Hills, and preserve the Valleys by his Power; and the Valleys shall bear its Increase when the Hills are barren; and my Sabbath of Rest I will require at their Hands, which would destroys the Valleys, and the Valleys shall be perpetual in my Rest, when the high Hills are destroyed with the Mountains of Israel, (after the Flesh); but the Valleys shall bear their Increase to my Glory, and stand in my Power and Church, and be defended by my Arm and Strength, saith the Lord. And as aforewritten, the Peace of the Law is in keeping the Commandments and live, (as saith the Gospel) and Acts of Charity, and to shew Mercy and Love to Neighbours is to be fulfilled, and is in the Peace of both Law and Gospel, and to them which are called and believe, they should live to the Peace of the Christian Faith, and shew Love to Neighbours, and suffer for the Faith, according to the Examples of the Gospel; the Severities of the
Law is useless to such as live in the suffering Faith of a Christian, which is to seek the good of all Nations; but Disobedience to the Gospel leads into the Severities and Judgments of the Law, and the Judgments of God also; Transgressor against Transgressor; and the Judgments of God are against Sin, under both the Law and Gospel, as the opening of the seven Seals in the Revelations of the Angel to John sheweth; and to enter into the Severities of the Law, such must partake of the Judgments of God against Sin, for their Disobedience to both the Law and Gospel, which saith, Keep the Commandments and live; and Christ's Sermon in the Mount, through that ever blessed Mouth Jesus of Nazareth, that is, Christ the Lord, the Spirit of Truth, spake in him, and as he delivered his Ministry saith, One jot or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the Law till all be fulfilled, Mat. 5.17. and them which will not live to the Blessings of Peace, and suffer, as the Examples of the Christian Faith did suffer, for their Testimonies in the Peace of the Gospel, such incur in that State the Judgments of God both upon themselves and Neighbours; and as afore-written, Christ's Sermon in the Mount, he there sheweth who are blessed, and he opened his Mouth and taught the Disciples and the Multitude present, saying, Blessed are the poor in Spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven; and blessed are they that mourn, for they shall be comforted; blessed are the Meek, for they shall inherit the Earth; blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after Righteousness, for they shall be filled; blessed are the Merciful, for they shall obtain Mercy; blessed are the pure in Heart, for they shall see God; blessed are the Peace-makers, for they shall be called the Children of God; blessed are they which are persecuted for Righteousness-sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven; and blessed are ye when Men revile you and persecute you falsly for my Name-sake, Mat. ch. 5. and after all these Blessings he saith, One jot or one tittle of the Law shall not pass away till all be fulfilled: And that the Commandments is the great Law which Jesus treated upon, is plain, the Pharisee asked, What good Thing shall I do that I may have eternal Life? And the Answer was, If thou wilt enter into Life, keep the Commandments; and he said, Which? And Jesus answered and said, Thou shalt do no Murder; thou shalt not commit Adultery; thou shalt not Steal; thou shalt not bear false Witness against thy Neighbour; honour thy Father and thy Mother; and thou shalt love thy Neighbour as thy self, Mat. 19.18, 19. and one of the Scribes asked him, Which is the first Commandment of all? And he answered, The first of all the Commandments is, Hear O Israel, the Lord our God is one Lord, Mark 12.29. (Deut. 6.4.) and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy Heart, and with all thy Soul, and with all thy Mind, and with all thy Strength; this is the first Commandment, and the second is like, namely this, Thou shalt love thy Neighbour as thy self; there is none other greater Commandments than these: and a Lawyer asking. Which is the great Commandment in the Law? receives the same Answer, Mat. 22.26. Luke 10.25. Deut. 11.13. and the great Example of the Christian Faith is, to bless them that curse you, and love your Enemies, do good to them that hate you, and to them that despitefully use you and persecute you: and to be perfect in the universal Spirit, which will gather all Nations; and in that Spirit of Love in the Truth, to be perfect in Love to all, as your Father which is in Heaven is perfect and good to all; and Christ came to save Mens Lives, and not to destroy them; and the Law points to Obedience, and keeping the Commandments of God, and the Covenants which are given in his Grace, to support his People, that they may renew their Strength, and live for ever in the support of his Grace; and to keep his Statutes, which Statutes of Love and Mercy, and the Commandments are united together; and to love the Lord thy God, (and saith the Gospel, Thou shalt love thy Neighbour as thy self) and in the Love of God, not to covet any thing that is thy Neighbours, nor to bear false Witness against thy Neighbour, and to honour thy Father and Mother that thy Days may be long in the Land which the Lord thy God giveth thee; and these Commandments and Statutes are in the Path-way to Life, under both the Law and Gospel; and to obey the Commandments and Statutes, and the Covenant in the Commandments, is entering Christ's Kingdom of Peace, which leads to the Father in the Peace of Obedience, to live for ever in the Works of the Spirit, as the Works of the Spirit
is obeyed, so to rest in Spirit by Obedience, and to follow the Example the Lord Creator hath given to keep his Holy Rest, and hath put it into a Command, that his great Command should be obeyed; but to live neither to the Commandments of God, and the Peace therein contained (to them which keep Covenant with God) and obey his Statutes in the Commandments, neither obey the Gospel of Peace, then the Judgments upon the Generations will be just, and the Wrath of God and the Lamb will break forth hot upon one Generation after another; and they that live not to the Gospel, bring themselves under the Judgments of both the Law and the Gospel; and, saith Moses, Know therefore that the Lord thy God he is God, the faithful God, which keepeth Covenant and Mercy with them that love him and keep his Commandments to a thousand Generations, and repayeth them that hate him to their Face, to destroy them he will not be slack, Deut. 7.9. so as the Measure of every Generation is full, for their Disobedience to both the Law and Gospel the Lord, will visit the World in Judgments, till they come to see his Kingdom of Mercy and Peace, by being obedient to his Will, and upon these Terms he hath sent his Son to bless his People that obey him and keep his Commandments; and Moses's Exhortation to the People is, Thou shalt teach them diligently unto thy Children, and shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine House, and when thou walkest by the Way, and when thou lieth down, and when thou risest up, and thou shalt bind them for a Sign upon thine Hands, and they shall be as Frontlets between thine Eyee, and thou shalt write them upon the Posts of thy House, Deut. 6.7, 8, 9. and this was not only to the Children of Israel going in to possess the Land of Canaan, but to every Generation after to teach their Children, for the Lord's Mercy to them that keep his Commandments is promised to a thousand Generations of them that love him, and his hate also to them that hate him and keep not his Commandments. It needs no Inspiration to wait to know whether any People should keep the Ten Commandments, because they are to be teached to their Children from Generation to Generation; and the Lord's promises of Mercy is to a thousand Generations of them that love him, and to repay his hate to such Generations that after they are teached keep not the Commandments of God; and remember the Angel in the Revelations to John hath foretold, The Dragon was Wrath and persecuted the Woman, (that is the Church) and went to make War with the remnant of her Seed, which keep the Commandments of God, and have the Testimony of Jesus Christ; so the Commandments, and to have the Faith of Jesus Christ is not to be separated, and a good Foundation is laid for keeping the Lord's Rest; first, as afore-written, after his great and glorious six Days work, he kept it himself; and when he called the Church, he shewed a Miracle in raining of Manna from Heaven, to confirm the Church in the keeping his Rest; and after appeared upon Mount Sinai, with Thundrings, and Lightnings, and a thick Cloud upon the Mountain; and Mount Sinai was altogether on a Smoke, because the Lord descended upon it in Fire, and the Mountain quaked greatly; and when the Voice of the Trumpet sounded long, and waxed louder and louder, Moses spake, and God answered him by a Voice; and all the People saw the Thunderings, and Lightnings, and the Noise of the Trumpet, and the Mountain smoking: So the Lord confirmed the Church by shewing of Miracles, and they heard the Voice of his Words and promised Obedience; and every Generation is to learn and teach their Children, and obey the Voice; and for Sin and Disobedience the World will provoke the Lord to let in his Fiery Appearance of which they were once afraid, Deut. 5. and 5.25. as Israel, when they heard the Lord's Voice out of the midst of the Fire, saying, This great Fire will consume us, if we hear the Voice of the Lord our God any more, then we shall die; so they heard the Covenant, and notwithstanding the new Covenant is writ in the Heart, and put in the Mind, yet that does not abolish the keeping the Ten Commandments of the Lord thy God. And the Prophet Jeremiah which foretels, The Law shall be written in the Heart, and put in the inward Parts; he calls also to keep the Sabbath, ch. 17.20, 27. and the Prophet speaking of the new Covenant, and the Apostle making the first Covenant old; the first Covenant, that is, of Offerings to be accepted as Atonements for Sin, he then shews the new Covenant written
in the Heart, Heb. 8.8. Jerem. 31.31, 32, 33, 34. and that by Christ's eternal Priesthood the Levitical Priesthood is abolished, and the Temporal Covenant by the Eternal; and the Apostle sheweth, That when Solomon had built a House to praise the Lord in, there were Ordinances of Divine Service and a Worldly Sanctuary, for there was a Tabernacle made first, wherein was the Candlestick, and the Table, and the Shew-Bread, which is called the Sanctuary, and the second Vail had the Golden Censor, (a Testimony against them which offered false Fire, Numb. 16.46. and ch. 17.10.) and the Golden Pot that had Manna; (a Remembrance of the Miracle wrought when the Lord called the Church to keep his Rest) and Aaron's Rod that budded and blossomed, to shew God's Power and Servants from them that rebelled against him; and these Things were kept in the Tabernacle of Witnesses near the Oracle, as Remembrances of God's Power and Faithfulness to uphold his Church; and Moses received the Tables of Testimony, the Tables of Stone, and put them in the Ark, and there was nothing in the Ark save the two Tables of Stone, which Moses put there at Horib, when the Lord made a Covenant with the Children of Israel when they came out of the Land of Egypt, 1 Kings 8.9, 21. and Moses bears Witness, The Tables were the Work of God, and the Writing was the Writing of God graven upon the Tables, Exod. 32.16. And after the Lord indued Solomon with Wisdom to build him a House to praise his Name in, the Tabernacle was adorned with the Works of God's Power, and the Testimonies were laid up in the Ark, and the Glory of the Lord filled the Temple; and this visible Building points to the new and spiritual Building which comes down from Heaven, from God, having the Glory of God; and in this City the Lord God and the Lamb are the Temple of it; and this City had no need of the Sun, neither of the Moon to shine in it, for the Glory of God did lighten it, and the Lamb is the Light thereof, Revel. 21.11, 23. and this spiritual Building will exceed the Glory of the former which Solomon built; and it is the same God which sanctifies his People, and builds up his spiritual House: And saith the Apostle, as speaking of Burnt-Offerings and Sacrifices, If the first Covenant had been faultless, then should no place have been found for the second; but these Offerings has no relation to the Lord's holy Rest, that is for ever pure, and without fault, and to be kept holy. The Power of God which appeared in Moses was a Light to the World, and his Obedience to the Power shines to this Day; and Moses obeyed the Angel of the Covenant, which covenanted with him and the People in Egypt, and coming out of Egypt, and did give Signs and do Wonders before Pharoah, and in the sight of the Egyptians, to confirm the Worship of the true God by his Power which they saw was with them; and Israel was led by the Right-Hand of Moses, with the glorious Arm of God's Power, through the Angel of Power, for the Lord refusing to go in Person, he sent the Angel of his Presence, the Angel of his Power in his Name, and promised to give them rest, Exod. 33.14. and the Angel of the Lord appeared in the Bush, and represents the Person of God, for the Word through the Angel said, I am the God of thy Father, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob; and the Angel of his Presence did Covenant with the People in the Lord's Name, and the Name of the Lord was proclaimed before them, and his Goodness to pass before them, and the Lord owned the Covenant, saying, I am the Lord thy God which brought thee out of the Land of Egypt, out of the House of Bondage, (that is, you came out by my Power) with Signs, and Miracles, and terrible Judgments: And as the Angel of God's Presence was with Moses, confirming the People by Signs and Miracles, to know the one true God and worship him; so the Angel of God's Presence was with Jesus, the great Prophet, like unto Moses, and the Work of the Power appeared in him by Signs and Miracles wrought in the Power of God, to confirm the Work in the Gospel Dispensation, and to worship the one God in Spirit and in Truth, John 4.24. and the Power and Peace of the Words which he received of God, and gave to his Disciples, shines to this Day in the Gospel, which is Universal Love; and he is a holy Example under the Gospel, as was Moses under the Law; and to confirm the Gospel, he healed their Sicknesses, and dispossessed evil Spirits by the Word of God when present
with him, Luke 5.17. so that both the Law and Gospel is confirmed, shewing the Power of the one God, and the Power of God Christ the Lord, the Angel of his Presence, the Angel of the Covenant is leading up the Flock to the Father, to as many as follow the holy Example of Jesus and his Obedience; and Jesus was a Light to the World whilst in the World; and 'tis the one God which gives every Light, and the one God is to be distinguished from every Lord and Servant sent with the Words of God, for which Words sake they were called Lord, as speaking in the Light the Words of God; but the one God is the Lord Creator of Heaven and Earth, the Sea and the Fountains of Water, the great Deep, the Lord of Hosts is his Name, and his Word is the great Messias, telling all Things to this Day, the Deliverer of his People that trust in his Arm; and as the Law was the School-Master to lead up the Flock to Christ, so they which are teached in Christ's School, he leads them to God even the Father, dictating the Mind and Will of God to them by the Inspirations of his Word, the Law of the Spirit, which Law gives Light to know God even the Father, and Christ in Jesus, and Jesus in Christ; and the Law of the Spirit is a fresh visitation of the Word, to know God and his holy One▪ that is, the holy Spirit received from the one God, the Words of God sent in errant to do his Will; and in which Word Jesus was anointed with the Holy Ghost, and he teached his Disciples in that Word; he was led in Spirit by the Holy Ghost; he baptized with the holy Ghost; he was conceived or created in the Womb by the Power of the Holy Ghost, (yet the Person of the Holy Ghost is not Flesh) but a Representation of the Holy Power and Spirit, a Light sent down to teach and instruct and inspire Men, for all glorious Appearances descends from Heaven, and it is God which reveals Secrets, and opens Mysteries; and none knows the Father but the Son, and to whom the Son will reveal the Father; and the Son which reveals the Father is Spirit, as the Father is Spirit; so knowing the Church is in God, and the Pillar and Ground is Truth in keeping the Commandments (under both the Law and Gospel); and in keeping the Commandments and the Lord's holy Rest contained therein, is joyning to the Lord in Worship, and to that Church above, which will yet throw them down below which don't keep to Justice and Truth in the Gospel of Peace, according to the Commandments; and the Father is to be obeyed through the Son, and my Prayer to God is, to hold out to the end, and to honour the Father in the Spirit of the Son, which finds acceptance with the Father; and to keep the Commandments of God, and live in the Peace of the Gospel, as believing and well-knowing, there is Power in God to defend the Faith he gives; and my Message to the World is, for Acts of Charity, Peace and Love, and to call to Repentance, and to serve and obey the living God.
